loans.name: Arifa

texts.ru:
Arifa yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Arifa 48 let. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. Ona uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec.
texts.en: Arifa is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region.  She is married and has three children.  Arifa is 48 years old.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy sheep for increasing livestock quantities for sale.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years and breeds sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cans of cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Adiba

texts.ru: Адиба умная и добросовестная молодая мамочка. Она занимается предпринимательством. Ей в бизнесе помогает её мать. Её супруг уехал в России и не вернулся, а также там женился на другую женщину. Адиба с двумя несовершеннолетними детьми вернулась домой к своим родителям, и спустя 6 месяцев она официально развилась с мужом. Ей было тяжело, пережить все эти трудные моменты жизни и её мать всегда поддерживала её и дала ей хорошие советы. Затем она устроила своих детей в детсад, а сама начала свой бизнес. Вот уже более 4 года она занимается купля продажей женской одежды и у неё уже много постоянных клиентов. Адиба хотела бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки новой ассортимент товара с целью расширения бизнеса. Она заранее благодарит Киву и Имон Интернэшнл за поддержку и поощрение.
texts.en: Adiba is an intelligent and conscientious young mother and a businesswoman. Her mother helps her run the business. Her husband went to Russia for work but never returned to his home country because he married a woman in Russia. Adiba and her two minor children returned to her parents' home and six months later she divorced her husband. It was hard for Adiba to go through these difficult times. She was lucky to have her mother by her side. After her children went to the kindergarten, Adiba started her business, which is four years old by now. She sells women's clothes and has many loyal customers. Adiba is applying for a loan of 3000 USD in order to purchase a new assortment of goods and expand her business. She would like to thank in advance Kiva and Imon International for all their support and encouragement.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: In the photo is Samuel, 43. He is married and blessed with five children who are still in school. For the last 10 years, he has been operating a cafeteria. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business and employ more people. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia is married and has six children. Her schooling is up to the junior high level. Efia sells sugar and mortars in Abura, which she has done for 5 years. She is holding one of the mortars she has made in the photo. Efia helps her husband take care of the home. She will use this loan to purchase wood to make mortars to sell. Efia plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make mortars to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Kafouata

texts.fr: Kafouata  est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée à un gestionnaire et a  quatre enfants. Elle est une revendeuse depuis 1997. Kafouata achète et revend ses pagnes à sa clientèle, elle exerce son commerce de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne à lomé et quelques fois au bénin. Elle est seule impliquée dans son activité. elle sollicite son 2ème crédit de WAGES pour acheter des pagnes de marque Hitarget et Deluxe.
texts.en: Kafouata is 35 years old, married to an administrator and has 4 children. She has been a saleswoman since 1997 and has a one-woman business selling "pagnes" (traditional sarong-like clothing). Her business is itinerant and she gets her supplies in Lomé, and occasionally in Benin. She is requesting a second loan from WAGES so that she can buy some Hitarget and Deluxe pagnes.

loans.use: to restock on pagnes.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame  Astou habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée  et  évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 20 ans.  Elle s’adonne à la vente de tissus  et déodorants pour femmes. Elle a choisi son activité dans le but de ne pas rester oisive.  La période la plus favorable pour ses activités c’est les moments de fête. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 14 mois. Elle a déjà soldé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et d’autres articles de femmes   en vue des préparatifs  des  fêtes  de korité. Ces produits sont destinés à la vente.  Ce financement lui permettra d’augmenter et de diversifier les produits  qu’elle propose a sa clientèle. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui donne l’opportunité de  participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: Astou is 40 years old, married and lives in Senegal. She became a retailer because she wanted to keep busy, and has been active in the retail sector for over 20 years. She sells fabrics and deodorants for women and her business peaks during periods of festivity. She has been a member of a UIMCEC branch for 14 months and has already fully repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a new loan of 300 000 francs in order to buy fabrics and other products for her female clientele to buy for the festival of Korité (the celebration that marks the end of Ramadan). This loan will allow her to increase her stock and diversify the range of products she can offer to her customers. The increase in her profits will allow her to contribute to her daily expenses.

loans.use: to restock with various products for resale.

loans.name: Montazer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22-years-old, single and lives with three family members; two of them work.

Montazer has been an owner of a mobile phone shop since 2008, selling mobile phones and accessories. He worked with his brother for three years in this field so he has good experience and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2700 loan in order to purchase a computer, to make a digital ads and to renovate his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a computer, to make a digital ads and to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm nuts to make oil for sale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man with eight children between 24 and 5 years old living in his own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. He has been dealing in spare parts as well as mechanics for 10 years and he faces a challenge of inadequate tools, which affect the profits of his business. His dream is to own a big spare parts shop plus a garage. Julius needs the loan facility to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien is a 49-year-old married man with three children: one son and two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Minh City. His wife is a tailor. 

For the past six years, Tien has supported his family by running a general shop in front of his house. He sells a range of products from household items to personal use products. 

Tien would like to get a loan to buy new products such as many kinds of drinking water, beverages, and confectionery to sell in his store to better meet his customers' needs.

He hopes that he will be able to increase his income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: To buy new products (drinking water, beverages, confectionery) to sell in his general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Wangnidekon Group

texts.fr: WANGNIDEKON est un  groupement composé de douze personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même hameau au Bénin. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupe du nom de Houndéhinso est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houndéhinso est âgée de 61 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Bienvenu. Le couple a six enfants, dont trois sont à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Depuis dix huit ans environs, Houndéhinso vend de l'huile de palme et des noix de palme dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Houndéhinso mène comme activité la vente de "sodabi" (boisson alcoolisée locale). Houndéhinso achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Houndéhinso et les autres membres du groupement WANGNIDEKON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui leur servira à rehausser leur activité.
texts.en: WANGNIDEKON is a group of 12 people who all live in the same hamlet in Benin. This is their first loan request and is being made so that the group members can increase their level of business activity and fulfill their customer demand. The group´s representative is called Houndéhinso and has her hand raised in the picture. Houndéhinso is 61 years old and married to a farmer called Bienvenu. The couple have 6 children, some of whom go to school. They live together with 3 dependent children and both contribute towards the household expenses. Houndéhinso has been selling palm oil and palm nuts in her area for around 18 years, and has a sideline business selling "sodabi", a local alcoholic drink. She gets her supplies in Benin. She and the WANGNIDEKON group are requesting this first loan from ALIDé in order to enhance their businesses.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts, palm oil and "sodabi" for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells bags of charcoal in Abura. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. She responsibly assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to pay for the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen is a 34-year-old married woman. She lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by laminating papers and objects with plastic. For four years she has operated a food stall where she sells soup to people in her community.

Tuyen would like a loan to purchase new furniture, good quality raw materials and spices. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture, and to buy quality food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Atheer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24-years-old, single and lives with five family members; two of whom work.

Atheer has owned a store for sanitary wares and building materials since 2010. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is being well known in his surrounding area.

He is requesting $2400 loan in order to renovate and redecorate his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and redecorate his store.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 44 years old and  a single mother of three children between the ages of 19 and 24. She lives in her own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. She has been in the restaurant business for 13 years. In her business, she faces the challenges of price fluctuations and poor preservation methods. Her dream is to start offering outside catering services and to set up another restaurant. Constance intends to use the loan to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Banku is made from fermented corn dough and cassava dough. Araba makes banku at Essiam near Abura. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Araba has been selling banku for 10 years. She helps her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to help make banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant. She is showing the pot she uses for the preparation of the banku.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize to make banku.

loans.name: Twitekumurimo Group

texts.fr:
Emile fait partie du groupe Twitekumurimo. Le nom du groupe signifie « avoir du courage au travail ». Il est célibataire avec 3 personnes en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est l’école primaire. 

Emile est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver une race améliorée de riz à moindre coût. Dans les prochaines années, Emile voudrait vendre à un grand nombre de consommateurs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses petits frères et sœurs.
texts.en:
Emile is a member of the loan group Twitekumurimo which means "working hard". He is single with 3 persons in charge. Emile stopped going to school after middle school and is now a rice farmer. It is his first loan cycle with ACB and will use it to purchase fertilizer and to pay workforce for his rice crop. 
To grow his business, his strategy is to cultivate a superior breed of rice at lower cost. In the next years, Emile would like to sell his production to a large number of consumers. With the benefits, he plans to give education to his younger brothers and sisters.

loans.use: He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay the workforce to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 29 years old and married with two children between 9 and 2 years old. She is renting a house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for two years. She faces a challenge of price fluctuation, which affects the profits of her business. Her greatest desire is to set up a wholesale shop in town. Carol needs a loan to buy sugar, rice, and drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha lives in the village of Dilikauri, Zestaponi District, West Georgia. He is 36 years old. 

Gocha is leading the agricultural business in the family. They own two milk cows and one sheep and sell the dairy products on nearby town's open market. The family earns additional income through sales of grapes harvested from their family-owned 250 vine trees. Along with the family farm, Gocha also works as a loader in the village. 

Gocha is married and lives with his family: his wife Olja and his 16-year-old daughter. Olja has health problems and gets a monthly pension from the state in the amount of 70 Laris. Gocha’s daughter goes to school. The total average income of the family is 630 Laris, including Olja’s pension. 

Gocha requested credit for building a sheepcote (pen for sheep). Part of the credit will be used to purchase five sheep. He will start selling lambs and use the milk from the sheep to produce cheese, which will be sold on nearby town's open market as well. The income of the family will increase. In the future, Gocha plans to reinvest part of the income in the sheep-breeding business for its further development. The other part of the increased income will be used for improving the daily living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to build a sheep pen and five sheep

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan, 48 years old, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City.

For eight years, Thuan and her husband have been making money by running a stall where they sell coffee, beverages, and fruit juice to people in their community. She intends to use her loan to expand her business by buying new funiture and different kinds of beverages for sale.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and beverages to sell in her stall

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: The pans behind Ama are sold by her to her customers. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been selling pans for six years. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more pans to retail to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more pans to retail to her customers.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
H. is from Iraq. He is 50 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children.

H. has owned a food market since 2008, selling meat, fish, soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is located in an area where they are in need of foodstuffs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

H. decided to apply for $2400 loan in order to buy an electric diesel generator and two showcases for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an electric diesel generator and two showcases for his market.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 12 timbers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 20 jeans, 20 outfits and 18 ensembles

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Шерзод женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он ответственный и добросовестный человек. Он занимается откормом скота. Он покупает скот из местных рынков, а потом откармливает их в определенный период, а затем продает, когда они набирает вес. Он хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни.  Кроме этого он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он выращивает морковь, лук, картошку и пшеницу. Шерзод запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки скот. Он заранее хочет благодарит всех вас за помощь.
texts.en: Sherzod is married and is a loving father of 3 children.  He is a responsible and conscientious person.  He is involved in fattening up livestock.  Sherzod buys livestock from local markets, then fattens it up over a set period of time, and subsequently sells it once livestock gains weight.  Sherzod wants to provide a good quality of life for his family.  Besides this business, he is also involved in growing agricultural crops.  He grows carrots, onions, potatoes and wheat.  Sherzod is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock.  He wants to thank all of you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 35 years old and is married. She has a daughter and lives with her daughter and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Dung's husband works as a laborer in a steel company. Dung earns an income to support her family by running a store selling spare parts for vehicles. She intends to use her loan to buy a greater range of products to sell in her store to better meet her customers' needs.

She hopes her business  will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: To buy a range of vehicle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children.

Salem has been an owner of a food market since 2008, selling meat, fish, soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is located in an area where they are in need for foodstuffs. He has a good reputation and is well known in his surroundings.

He decided to apply for $2100 loan in order to make an outdoor ceiling and two showcases for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make an outdoor ceiling and two showcases for his market

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 59 years old and widowed. She supports a family of four. Her primary business is dairy farming and she has been in business for the past 20 years. Her monthly income from the business is KES 29,000.

This is her third loan with KADET. She paid her previous loans successfully. The loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her dream and hope is to ensure that her family is stable and her children study and get good jobs.

loans.use: To educate her children.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée à un chef magasinier et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est couturière de formation, elle achète des tissus pour confectionner des habits qu’elle revend à ses clients. Elle travaille seule dans son activité.
Komi sollicite le premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des tissus afin de confectionner des habits et les revendre.
texts.en: Abla is a 42-year-old woman who is married to a store manager. She is the mother of seven children. Abla is a trained seamstress. She buys fabrics to make clothing that she resells to her customers. She works by herself in her business. She is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to buy some cloth in order to make clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 43 years old and is married. She has three children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband have run a general store at their horse for five years. They sell milk, beverages, stationery, and confectionery. Hanh intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell in her store such as eggs, sugar, and personal sanitary items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy basic products and foods such as eggs, sugar, and sanitary items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rouba

texts.fr: Madame Rouba  est une femme mariée de 61 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle gère  7 enfants et évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle a choisi cette activité dans le souci de ne pas rester inactive. Et c’est une activité qui marche bien pour elle au moment des fêtes. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires a revendre destinés a relancer et élargir son activité de commerce. Ce financement lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière afin de mieux gérer les dépenses familiales.
texts.en: Madam Rouba is a 61 years-old woman who lives in Senegal. She takes care of 7 children and works for more than 10 years in the foodstuffs business. She chose this activity in order to not stay inactive. Her business is working pretty well and espacially during Holidays. She is a member of U-IMEC since April. Madam Rouba is applying to a 100 000 frs loan to purchase foodstuffs to resell in order to boost and expand her business. This loan will allow her to be financially independent and to better run the family spending.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and resell

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh, a 33-year-old single woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Oanh requests a loan to purchase more products such as soap, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as soap, candies, toilet paper and shampoo to stock her general store.

loans.name: Souwebatou

texts.fr:
Souwebatou est une femme de 53 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 03enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le premier 25 ans et le dernier a 15 ans.  
Souwebatou travaille comme revendeuse de céréales (maïs, blé, sorgho) et d’ignames depuis 16 ans. Elle vend à toute personne au marché d’Agoé. 
Souwebatou a requis son deuxième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames et des céréales. 
Elle veut stocker des céréales.
Dans les prochaines années, Souwebatou voudrait agrandir  l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut assurer l’épanouissement de  sa famille.
texts.en:
Souwebatou is a 53-year-old woman who is married to a retailer. She has three children who are all in school; the first-born is 25 years, and the last is 15. Souwebatou has been working as a retailer of grains (corn, wheat, and sorghum) and yams for sixteen years. She sells to anyone at the Agoé market. 

Souwebatou has requested her second loan cycle with WAGES in order to buy some yams and grain. She wants to stock grains. In the next few years, she would like to expand her business. With the profits, she says she wants to ensure that her family thrives.

loans.use: to buy grains and yams

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua buys palm fruits from the market and makes palm oil for sale in Abura. She is a single parent taking care of 7 dependants. Ekua has been selling palm oil for 6 years.  Her loan will be used to buy palm fruits to make oil for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits. She is shown with the mortar and pestle she uses for pounding the palm fruits. Any increase in profits she realizes would be used to buy a palm-oil-making machine.

loans.use: to buy palm fruits to make palm oil for sale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a farmer and a father aged 33. He has one child, aged four. He has been in farming in his hometown of Kitale for five years, with his milk, eggs and produce going to the local market.

Simon has requested for a loan of 52,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy cow will enable him meet his family's daily needs, as well as expand his business to be more reliable in meeting his needs.

Simon notes animal diseases and the high cost of feeds as the challenges in farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 46 years old and has three children: two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a driver.

Lang has been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of her house for the past five years. She sells a variety of basic goods, such as sugar, confectioneries, and basic household necessities. In addition, she sells many kinds of rice to her customers.

Lang would like to borrow money to expand her business by buying additional basic goods and household necessities as stock for her store. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, confectionery, and basic household necessities for selling.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells provisions and cooking utensils in Abura. Ekua has received junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a blacksmith. The business is about 10 years old. She assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to procure cooking utensils to resell.

loans.use: to procure cooking utensils to resell.

loans.name: Famines

texts.en:
Famines is 35 years old, a single lady  with four children aged 22, 20, 18 and 14. She operates a grocery and cereals store in Surungai trading center and has been in the business for a period of nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

This is her third loan and she will use the loan  to finance her business. She plans to purchase five bags of dry maize, one sack of rice, and two bags of dried beans.  The anticipated profits will be used to ploughed back into the business and educate her children.

She hopes to be a successful lady in her business.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of dry maize, one sack of rice, and two bags of dry beans.

loans.name: Noudonoukou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NOUDONOUKOU est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léontine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Léontine est âgée de 54 ans. C'est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à sa charge. Léontine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Léontine mène comme activité la vente de fruits de saison, mais également des conserves et des savons ; ce qui lui permet d'avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. Léontine exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a bien remboursé les deux premiers crédits qu'elle a obtenus de ALIDé. Léontine achète ses produits au Bénin et les vend dans son quartier. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Léontine sollicite un troisième crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du  groupe NOUDONOUKOU.
texts.en:
NOUDONOUKOU Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. It's the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group leader, Léontine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 54 years old, a widow, and has three children who all attended school. She still has to support one of them.

Léontine never attended school. To support herself, she sells seasonable fruits, but also canned food and soaps. This enables her to have several income sources.

She's been running this business for eight years, and repaid her first two ALIDé loans without problems. She gets her supplies in Benin, and resells in her neighborhood.

Eager to meet customer demand and increase her income, Léontine is seeking a third loan together with the other members of NOUDONOUKOU Group.

loans.use: to buy seasonable fruits, canned food and soaps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish and maize to make kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 39, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a labourer on construction sites. 

Phuong supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business three years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yoghurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products (foods and beverages) to stock and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Zipora

texts.en: Zipora is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with five children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She takes care of the family with help from her husband who is a businessman and their dream is to educate their children. She has been selling maize for eighteen years and her dream is to start exporting to nearby countries. Zipora needs the loan facility to buy sacks of maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy  sacks of maize to sell.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона умная, добросовестная и целеустремленная незамужняя девушка. Она живет со своим родителям. Она имеет свой свадебный салон там, где она дает в прокат свадебных платьев. Более 6 лет она занимается в данном бизнесе и имеет много клиентов. Она привозит модных и высококачественных платьев. Фарзона хотела бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки новых свадебных платьев. Она заранее хочет поблагодарит Киву и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку.
texts.en: Farzona is a smart, conscientious and goal-oriented single, young woman.  She lives together with her parents.  She has a wedding boutique, where she rents out wedding dresses.  Farzona has been involved in this business for over six years and has many customers.  She carries stylish and high-quality dresses.  Farzona wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of new wedding dresses.  She wants to thank Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase wedding dresses

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 25 years old, married to Esther Nelima.Together they have three children. His primary business is transportation. He has been in the business for the past three years. He gets a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This is his first loan with KADET. He plans to buy 15 bags of dried maize, to start a maize business. He plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business. His dreams and hopes are to expand his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy dried maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase varieties of fish and meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new furniture and more types of food to sell.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он арендует помещение, где занимается ремонтом телефонов и dvd. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для покупки запасных частей.
texts.en: Ismoil lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 46 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Ismoil leases a space, where he repairs telephones and DVD players.  He has been involved in this business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыкул 51 год, замужем, имеет 4 детей – 2 старшие дочери замужем и живут отдельно, одна дочь – студентка педагогического колледжа и младший сын учится в 8 классе местной школы. После распада Советского Союза, семья Бактыкул получила земельный надел, послуживший первым вложением в собственный бизнес.  Проработав в сфере полеводства до недавнего времени, Бактыкул решила продать участок и начать бизнес в животноводстве. Закупив бычков для откорма, она прилагает все усилия для развития собственного бизнеса.  Именно поэтому, Бактыгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетели. В будущем, женщина планирует дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Baktygul is 51 years old, married and has four children.  Two of her older daughters are married and live separately, one daughter is a student at a pedagogical college, and the youngest son attends eighth grade at a local school.  After the fall of the Soviet Union, Baktygul's family received a plot of land, which served as the first investment into their own business.  After working in the farming business until a recent time, Baktygul decided to sell the land and start an animal husbandry business.  She bought calves for fattening up and uses all her efforts to develop her business.  This is why Baktygul went to the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to request a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two heifers.  In the future, she plans to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm fruit to make oil to sell.

loans.name: Méritouré

texts.fr:
Méritouré est une femme  de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un artiste. Elle a 02 enfants qui vont  à l’école. Le premier a 11ans et le dernier 05 ans.  
Méritouré fait le commerce des produits d’alimentation générale (boîtes de conserve, des bidons d’huile et des bols de riz) et des jouets d’enfant depuis 11ans. Elle sert toute sorte de client dans sa maison. Elle achète les produits à LOME. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente après les périodes de fête. 
Méritouré a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 5 bidons d’huile et 10 sacs de riz. Elle veut réinvestir son bénéfice dans son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Méritouré voudrait rendre son activité durable. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit rendre son ménage heureux.
texts.en:
Méritouré is a 35-year-old woman who is married to an artist. She has two children, who attend school. They are 11 and 5 years old. For eleven years, she has been doing commerce in grocery items (canned foods, containers of oil, and basins of rice) and children's toys. She has all sorts of customers at her house. She buys the goods from Lomé. At the moment, her main difficulty is a drop in sales following the holidays. 

Méritouré has requested her first loan cycle from WAGES in order to buy 5 containers of oil and 10 sacks of rice. She wants to reinvest her profits into her business. 

In the next few years, Méritouré would like to make her business sustainable. With the profits, she says she expects to make her home a happy one.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Violett

texts.en: Violett is a 40-year-old young woman who is married with two sons. She is employed as a secretary and her husband is a construction worker with a low salary. Violett wants to pay the university tuition fees for her son but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Violett gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will easily pay her son's university tuition fees so he can complete his university studies and improve the family life positively. Violett is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married to Nancy. Together they have six children who go to school. His primary business is farming.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET officer. This is his fourth loan term with KADET. He paid his previous loans successfully. He plans to use the loan amount to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Quynh

texts.en:
Quynh is a 27-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has a son. She and her husband earn money by making and repairing jewelry. They started this business 10 years ago.

Quynh would like to take a loan to buy a cutter for her business. She hopes that through this loan she will be abL. to increase the turnover of her business. This will enabL. her to increase her income, save for the education of her child and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cutter for making and repairing jewelry.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with five family members, two of whom work. 

Ahmad has been an owner of a food market since 2008 that sells meat, fish, soft drinks, juices, and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is located in an area where they are in need of foodstuffs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area. 

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy an electric diesel generator and a tricycle truck. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to buy an electric diesel generator and a tricycle truck.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe/ Kzh Group

texts.fr:
Torojani fait partie du groupe Abunzubumwe/KZH. Le nom du groupe signifie « unir les gens ». Il est marié avec 4 enfants de 1 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. 

Torojani est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver une race améliorée de riz à moindre coût. Dans les prochaines années, Torojani voudrait vendre à un grand nombre de consommateurs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses petits frères et sœurs.
texts.en:
Torojani is a member of the group loan Abunzubumwe/KZH which means "bind people together". He is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 12 years. 3 of them are going to school. Torojani is a rice farmer. It is his first loan cycle with ACB and wants to use it to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the workforce to cultivate rice. 
To grow his business, his strategy is to cultivate a superior breed of rice at lower cost. In the next years, Torojani would like to sell his production to a large number of consumers. With the benefits, he plans to give education to his younger brothers and sisters.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay the workforce to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Efia

texts.en: Efia supplies her customers with bags of charcoal when she receives orders for them. She is married. Her customers have increased and it has affected the volume of charcoal she needs to supply; a loan will help to meet the sudden demand for more charcoal.

loans.use: to meet the sudden demand for more charcoal.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en:
Thom is 56 years old and single. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

For nearly 20 years, Thom has run a small street-side restaurant selling meals and soups in the local community. 

Thom now intends to get a loan to repair her street-side restaurant and purchase a greater quantity and variety of food to attract more customers. She hopes that the loan will increase her income and enable her to improve her well-being.

loans.use: To repair her restaurant and purchase more food for selling.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is a farmer in Litein aged 33 and married with 3 children aged between 12 and  3 years. He has been farming in his hometown of Litein for over 20 years producing and selling tea, bananas and milk for the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business for additional income.

Philemon has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow to boost his dairy business. He says the additional dairy cow will improve his income and family family well being.

Philemon mentions lack of funds as the major challenge in his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
For some time now Aba has been producing Fante kenkey. Fante kenkey is a common dish (of fermented corn dough wrapped in plantain or banana leaf) popular in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. 

Aba supports her husband in taking care of the home. Aba will use the loan to obtain bags of maize to make kenkey to sell. Aba plans to reinvest the new profits back into the business.

loans.use: to obtain bags of maize to make kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is from the village Dablatsikhe, Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is 60 years old and lives with her family: her husband Amrosi, a 40 year old son, her daughter in law and her 6 year old grandson. Her grandson goes to school. 

Mzia owns a small grocery store in her village. She purchases grocery products in Kutaisi's (nearby town) wholesale market once each month. Mzia’s clients are the villagers. Her daily turnover is 50 Laris. Along with the above mentioned trade business, Mzia is also involved in family agricultural activities – they have 2 milk cows. She produces and sells on average 25 kg of cheese per month. Mzia’s husband and son are drivers; together they earn 490 Laris per month. Her daughter in law is a teacher in a local school. 

Total average income of the family is 1000 Laris. Mzia requested credit for increasing stock in trade in her store. After increasing the assortment of the products, her turnover and consequently her profit will increase. Mzia plans to reinvest increased profits in the same business – she plans to renovate her store in order to become more competitive in the local market and attract more customers.

loans.use: to renovate her grocery store to become more competitive

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 27 years old, married and has two children.  For six years, he has been operating a retail shop.  He also owns a motorbike which he uses for transport business.  He was previously employed before he went into business.  He went into business after getting motivation through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management.
Henry desires to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested for 100, 000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and rice.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: The picture above depicts Ekua selling food items such as fresh tomatoes, onions, spices, garden eggs and other things at Abura. She is married and has 5 children. As part of her responsibilities, she makes sure the children are fed every day. The loan will be used to obtain more tomatoes, onions spices, garden eggs and other items to sell.

loans.use: to obtain more tomatoes, onions spices, garden eggs and other items to sell.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is the mother of three children, two sons and one daughter. She is 59 years old and lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns a living selling beverages in her community. Tu has run this business in front of her house for five years. 

Tu would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and range of beverages to sell from her shop. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity and range of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other supplies for baking.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has 4 children. She has received junior high education. Aba smokes fish in Abura, which she has done for 4 years. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to assist her husband to take care of the home. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest for further growth.
To smoke the fish, you need to go to the sea shore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen.  When you come home with the fish, you clean them. Once you drain the water from the fish, the fish will be ready to be smoked. Firewood and a traditionally-built oven are prepared to smoke the fish. The cooking time for the fish varies depending on the size of the fish and their arrangement in the oven. 
The most important thing about this process is that it is the smoke, not the fire, that cooks the fish. The smoke gives the fish its dark color. Green leaves are used as coverings for the fish to prevent the smoke from escaping into the air. The heat should also be moderate as too much heat would not allow the fish to cook properly.
Cape Coast is a town in the Central Region of Ghana that is known to be a fishing community. Most women in this region are fishmongers who supply other surrounding villages with fish.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh is a 51-year-old married man with two sons. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City with his wife and children. 

Vinh and his wife sell noodles to people in the local community. They have done this for the past ten years.

Vinh plans to take a loan to expand his business by buying bread, pork, and furniture for his stall so that he can better serve his existing customers and attract new ones. He hopes his business will run smoothly and he will be able to earn more money to cover his family's living expenses.

loans.use: To expand the business by buying bread, pork, and furniture for his food stall.

loans.name: Mwaffaq

texts.en: Mwaffaq is a 19-year-old young man. He has his own project, which is a store for clothing sales that is located in a good area and is the only source of income for him. Mwaffaq wants to prepare for the coming winter season by purchasing new collection of winter clothes. He has some money but it is not enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,500 from FATEN. When Mwaffaq gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to prepare for the coming winter season by purchasing the new collection to sell, increase his income and live in better conditions. Mwaffaq is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Dibamaka Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un architecte dessinateur. Elle a 03 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 09 ans et le dernier a 03 ans.  
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse de boisson de la Brasserie du Bénin depuis 2005. Elle sert sa clientèle dans sa maison. 
Akouvi a requis son troisième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des casiers de boisson. Elle veut économiser pour agrandir son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akouvi voudrait un autre débit de boisson. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants dans les meilleures écoles de la région.
texts.en: Akouvi is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a planner-architect. She has three children, of whom two are in school. The first-born is 9 years old, and the last is 3. Akouvi has been working as a retailer of beverages from the Brasserie du Bénin since 2005. She serves her customers out of her house. She has requested her third loan cycle from WAGES in order to buy some cases of beverages. She wants to save money to expand her business. In the next few years, Akouvi would like to have another beverages outlet. With the profits, she says she expects to make sure her children are educated in the best schools in the region.

loans.use: to buy cases of beverages

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is married and a father of four.  He does farming to earn a living.  He is also a mason by profession.  He has been able to improve his farming through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  His desire is to set up a greenhouse so as to reduce farming costs.
Martin hopes to expand his farm for more income generation.  He needs a loan of 15, 000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizer

loans.name: Shavkatullo

texts.ru: Шавкатулло женат и у них двое детей. Он добрый и целеустремленный человек. Он любит свою семью и хочет содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Он хочет устроит своих детей в садик, чтобы они стали умненькими детьми. Шавкатулло занимается купля продажей овощей и фруктов на местном рынке. Он приобретает товар у фермеров, имеющихся дехканских хозяйств, потому что они продают дешево. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000$  США для покупки овощей и фруктов. Так как начинается сезон сбор урожая, он хочет покупать побольше товаров дешево.
texts.en: Shavkatullo is married and has two children.  He is a kind and goal-oriented person.  He loves his family and wants to provide good quality of life for them.  He wants to place his children into a kindergarten, so that they become smart children.  Shavkatullo is involved in buying and selling vegetables and fruits at the local market.  He buys products from farmers, who have dekhan farms and, hence, sell their products cheaper.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of vegetables and fruits.  He wants to buy more products at cheaper cost now that the harvesting season is starting.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is 49 years old married. She has four children aged eight, 12, 15 and 18 years. She is a shopkeeper in Kapsabet and has been in business for the past five years earning a monthly income of KES 12,000.

This is her third term loan after she successfully paid the previous loans well and in good time.  She wishes to spend the money to purchase 10 cartons of washing soaps, five bags of sugar, five bales of wheat flour and 10 bales of maize flour. 

The profits will be used to plough back into her business and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to prosper in business and see her children excel in life.

loans.use: To purchase  more stock of washing detergent, five bags of sugar, wheat flour, and maizeflour

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
53-year-old Van lives with her two daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Van has supported her family by running a general store for nine years. She sells confectionery, cheese, lighters, cigarettes, and different kinds of snacks to people in her community. This work provides her and her family with a daily income to meet the family's basic living expenses.

Van would like to take out a loan to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity and range of basic foods and goods to sell to her customers from her general store. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family and save for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity and range of basic foods and goods to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 36 years old farmer from the village Kveda Sazano, Imereti Region. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Tamila, 6 year old daughter, 3 year old son, 78 year old mother (retired) and 39 year old sister. The latter has health problems and gets relevant monthly pension from the state. Mikheil’s children go to school. Tamila is a housewife. 

Mikheil is leading the agricultural business of the family. They own 2 cows and sell dairy products on Zestaponi (nearby town) market. Also the family gets income from sales of grapes and nuts harvested on a family owned 1.5 hectare plot of land, where 150 nut trees and 1500 vine trees are grown. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris, including the pensions of Mikheil’s mother and sister. 

Mikheil requested credit for expansion of the dairy farm. He plans to purchase an additional milk cow to produce and sell 50% more cheese and thus increase the income of the family. Increase in income will allow Mikheil’s family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Cherono

texts.en:
Cherono is aged 27 and is a farmer in Litein area, South Rift Kenya. She is married with 2 children age 4 and 2 and has been in farming for 4 years. She fully relies on farming for her family upkeep. Her farm produces tea, milk and eggs.

Cherono has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She has previously requested two loans which she promptly repaid. She says her focus is to have three dairy cows and use the income generated to educate her children.

She compliments Juhudi for availing smallholder farmers with loans but laments about high costs of maintenance for the dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, 47 years old, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and her daughter in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ngoc's husband earns money as a driver. Ngoc supports her family by sewing packing bags at her house. Ngoc would like to take a loan to buy a sewing machine to increase her production.

Ngoc hopes her business runs smoothly and that she will help to improve her family's living conditions and provide her daughter with a good education.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to increase production

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан 44 года, вдова, имеет троих детей. Так как Бурмакан является единственным кормильцем для своей семьи, она прилагает все усилия для обеспечения своих детей всем необходимым. В 1996 году Бурмакан начала свой бизнес в торговле. В 2005 году, взяв кредит в сумме 22,000 сом (KGS), Бурмакан выбрала направление  в торговле детской одежды и отработала кредит своевременно и без просрочек. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурмакан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она планирует расширить ассортимент предоставляемых товаров. На частичные доходы от кредита, Бурмакан планирует сделать хороший ремонт дома.
texts.en: Burmakan is 44 years old, a widow and has three children.  Because Burmakan is the only provider for her family, she uses all her efforts to support all of her children's needs.  She started her retail business in 1996.  Having taken out a loan in the sum of 22,000 som (KGS) in 2005, Burmakan chose to focus on sales of children's clothing and repaid that loan in a timely manner and without delays.  To further develop her business, Burmakan went to the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to request a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS).  She plans to use the obtained funds to expand her merchandise selection.  Burmakan also plans to use part of the income from the loan to make quality repairs to her house.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 31 years old and married. She has four children aged three, five, seven and twelve years. She sells cereals in Kaptildil trading centre. She has been in the business for the past three years. She gets a monthly income of KES 18,000.  

This is her third term loan and she will use the amount to finance her business.  She hopes to purchase 26 bags of dry maize and 25 bags of dry beans to boost her business. The anticipated amount will be used to add more stock as well as for her family upkeep.Her dream is to become a successful lady in business and also educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 32 years old and a father of one.  To earn a living, he uses his bicycle for transport business.  He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more business oriented.  Now, he sees himself owning more than five motorbikes for transport business in the future.  

Benjamin needs a loan of 50, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike for his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transport business

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам проживает в районе Яван. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него 8 детей. Его сын находится на заработках в России. Сам он занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа двух голов бычков.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the Yavan district.  He is 48 years old, married and has 8 children.  His son works in Russia.  Rustam is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for subsequent sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of two calves.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong is 47 years old and married. He has two children, one son and one daughter. He lives with his wife and children in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns an income by selling cashew nuts. 

Cuong supports his family by running a beauty shop at his house. He has been engaged in this activity for over 12 years. He intends to borrow money to buy additional hairdressing tools and related products to enable him to attract more customers and increase his income. He hopes that with the requested loan, his business will expand and he can better financially support his family.

loans.use: To buy additional hairdressing tools and related good quality products.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a 28 year old married lady. Mesaid sells kangas and clothes in Mombasa. She has been in this business for the last three years.

This is her third loan in KADET. With this loan she plans to add more bales of cloth and kangas. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: Add more bales of cloth and kangas

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc, a 38-year-old married man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He has a son. He and his wife earn an income by selling many kinds of beads and hair pins in their community. They have been in this business for ten years.

Duc requires a loan to purchase a greater quantity and range of different products, including beads, pins, and assorted hair and beauty accessories, to better serve his customers. He hopes that will permit him to attract more customers, to earn more income, and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a range of hair and ornamental products (beads, pins, assorted hair accessories) for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 34 years old, married and has three children.  He sells woven baskets, ropes and brooms to earn a living.  He has been running the business for two years and has employed one person.  He also runs a retail shop so as to earn extra income for his family.
Benjamin has learned how to save his money since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He has also been able to boost his business.  He has requested a loan of 45, 000 Kenya shillings buy woven baskets.

loans.use: To buy woven baskets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock for his shop

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is 31 years old. He is married to Penina; they have no children yet. He owns a motorbike that he uses to offer transportation means to the residents of Kiserian, Nairobi. He has been doing this business for the last three years and gets an income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

He was introduced to KADET by KADET staff. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD with which he plans to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike. He will use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike. He hopes to have a taxi through his hard work.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the motorbike.

loans.name: Veronica Awino

texts.en: Veronica is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 2 and 6. She describes herself to be industrious, intelligent, and honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells onions, tomatoes, fruits, and cereals. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. Her primary customers are local households and travelers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate space for business operations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase vegetables and maize for sale. Her business goal is to become involved in the sale of ready-made clothing within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and maize for sale

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is aged 31 and has been farming in the Kitale area of western Kenya for 10 years. He is married with two children aged 7 and 1. He does timber lumbering for additional income. His farm produces milk and timber for the local market.

Kennedy has requested a loan of 41,600 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy income will boost his income and enable him to buy more farm implements and a power saw for the lumbering business.

Kennedy sees the lack of business funds and animal diseases as the greatest threats to his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Хайринисо проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 49 лет. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Хайринисо имеет средне - специальное образование, она по профессии медсестра. В этой области она проработала 10 лет. На сегодняшний день Хайринисо занимается выращиванием овощей для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа топлива и семян лука.
texts.en: Khayriniso lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 49 years old, divorced and has two children.  Khayriniso has a secondary specialized education; she is a nurse by profession.  She spent 10 years working in that field.  Today, Khayriniso is involved in growing vegetables for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fuel and onion seeds.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and onion seeds

loans.name: Fida'ee

texts.en: Fida'ee is a 40-year-old young man who is married and has two sons. He lives in Ramallah city in Palestine. Fida'ee drives a taxi that he owns and it is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase a car repair kit and pay for licensing and insuring the taxi, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Fida'ee takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase the repair kit for the taxi to fix things when needed and to pay for licensing and insuring the taxi so it will be legal. Fida'ee will work extra hours to increase his income and live with his family in better conditions. Fida'ee is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and insuring his car and to buy a car repair kit.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is a 31-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has a daughter. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for four years. They sell milk, coffee and instant foods.

Vi would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as foods and beverages to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that through this loan her business will generate a higher income and help her improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy more instant foods and beverages for selling.

loans.name: Aurelie

texts.en:
Aurelie is 31 years old and is married with one child who is one year old. Her business is well-organized and is well known in the business of selling various goods such as: lotions, biscuits, soap, sugar, cooking oil etc. Her business hours are from 8am until 7pm every day except on Saturday and she currently employs one person to help her.

Aurelie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying new more goods such as: lotions, biscuits, soap, cooking oil etc for sale. With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future. Aurelie hopes also to pay school fees for her children and she will be able to buy a cow with her profits.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: lotions, biscuits, soap, cooking oil etc to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock and expand business

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 28 years old and single. He supports himself. For the past four years, Titus has owned a retail shop in the Chepterit trading center. He earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Titus is requesting his third KADET loan to purchase two bags of brown sugar, one bale of wheat flour, and 10 kilograms of rice. He will use the profits from his loan to pay school fees for his younger brother and to repay his loan. In the future, he dreams of owning a supermarket and having a stable income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase brown sugar, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 46-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh city. She has a son and her husband is a bricklayer. Hanh earns an income to support her family by running a business that specializes in selling veterinary medicine and equipment. She has been in this business for ten years. 

Hanh is requesting a loan to expand her business and buy a larger variety of medicine and equipment to offer better services and increase her business capacity. She hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase her income and better support her family.

loans.use: to buy veterinary medicine and equipment

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a widow with four children ages 11, 17, 28, and 32. They are all in school, except for the youngest. For the past 18 years, Mariam has owned a restaurant where she sells African dishes. Her restaurant income helps her care for her family. 

Mariam is requesting a loan to buy sugar, beans, and rice to cook in the restaurant. With the profits from her loan, she would like to start building a new house and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grinder and a welding machine

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en:
Nhu is 42 years old and is married. She has two children, a son and a daughter, and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income by making and selling beverages and many kinds of foods for meals. They started this business ten years ago.

Nhu requires a loan to purchase new furniture for her food stall and repair her house. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase turnover. She also hopes that this will increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new furniture for her food stall and repair her house.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her late 20s, is married with one small child.  She has had a beauty salon business for one year now. She works from 8 a.m to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy salon equipment. Her dream is to be able to open another salon one day.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Baraka" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Borsulton

texts.ru: Борсултон жительница района Шахритус. Ей 54 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Борсултон имеет среднее образование. Она занимается животноводством, она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа трех голов мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Borsulton lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 54 years old, married and has four children.  Borsulton has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry and primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  She breeds livestock at home.  Borsulton has been involved in this business for ten years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of three heads of small livestock.

loans.use: to buy three heads of small livestock

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 33, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. Her husband is a driver. She lives with her 2 children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Lien has been in business since 2008. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials for hairdressing services.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Mary Louise is married and has 4 children who are all in school. Her husband works out of the country. She runs a general store in which she sells rice, cooking oil, soap etc. She has used the profits to take care of her children. She needs a loan to buy more items for her store. She would like to use the profits to pay for school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy food items that she will sell in her general store

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 52-year-old widowed woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. She earns a living running a general store, which she has done for eight years. 

Hong would like T. take out a loan T. buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and beverages T. stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her T. better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through this loan her business will generate a higher income and help her T. improve her family's living conditions and enable her T. save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy basic goods (snack foods and beverages) to stock her store.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 30 years old and married. His primary business is carpentry and he has been in business for four years. The business gives him a monthly income of KES 5,000.

This is his third loan with KADET LTD . He plans to use the loan to buy more timber for carpentry work. The anticipated profit from the business will help him support his sister and children. 


His dreams and hopes are to ensure that his family is stable financially.

loans.use: To buy more timber for carpentry work

loans.name: Fenesi Group

texts.en:
Sophia, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who go to school. She has had a retail shop for three years now.  She works from 6 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania, given in the middle of the main loan term, that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their loans smoothly, to receive half of the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loan to increase inventory levels for items she was running low on at the shop and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to increase her retail shop inventory.  Her dream is to be able to own a beauty salon one day.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Fenesi" which has a total of 9 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is a 49-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City with his wife and children. 

Luong and his wife earn income by selling food, fruit juice and beverages from their food stall. They have done this for 11 years. 

Luong plans to take a loan to expand his business by buying bread, pork, and furniture for his stall so that he can better serve his existing customers and attract new ones. Luong hopes that his business will run smoothly and that he will be able to earn more money to cover his family's living expenses.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying bread, pork and furniture for his food stall.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past five years he has operated a fruit selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. Mohamed faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

Mohamed is applying for our Sikukuu product which was launched for the Muslims celebration. With the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and detergents for personal use. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and detergents for personal use.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh, 41, is the mother of two sons. Together with her husband and children, Binh lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Binh's family depends on the income that Binh makes from selling groceries from her stall in a local street market. Binh began this business five years ago.

Binh sells many kind of food and vegetables such as soy-bean cakes, eggs, instant noodles, water morning glory, cucumbers, pineapples, beansprouts and cabbage in her stall. Binh would like a loan to buy a greater variety and higher quality of fruit and vegetables so that she can attract more customers. 

Binh hopes that, through the loan, she will be abL. to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and higher quality of fruit and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a businessman. He is married and has one child. He sells cosmetics and baby clothing to earn a living. He has been in this business for five years and has employed one person. He is also a teacher by profession. He has managed to grow his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  

He hopes to open a beauty college in five years. He needs a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ancille

texts.en: Ancille is a widow and has two children, ages 16 and 18. Her children have been unable to finish school. She runs a general store in which she sells donuts, water, soda, tea, and a local drink called ubushera which is made out of sorghum. She has been running this business for eight years and it has enabled her to care for her children. She needs a loan to buy sorghum to make the local soft drink and buy some other snacks to stock her store. She will use the profits to renovate her house.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients for a local soft drink ans snacks that she will sell in her store.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 23 years old and single. He supports his aging parents. He is a milk seller in Kapsabet. He has been in this business for the past two years. His monthly income is 4,400 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This is his first loan and he desires to use the amount to pay milk suppliers. The profits will be used to repay the loan as well as his parent's upkeep. He hopes to expand his business and pursue a teaching career.

loans.use: to pay milk suppliers.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 28 years old. She lives with her family in Samtredia, Imereti Region, West Georgia. Natia’s family consists of 5 members: herself, husband Merab, 5-year-old daughter, and her parents-in-law. Natia works as teacher at a local school. Along with her job, she is actively involved in the family agricultural business. In particular, they have a greenhouse with a total area of 200 sq. meters. In the winter, the family grows onions in the greenhouse, and in the summer, tomatoes. Also, the family grows strawberries on family-owned land and sells them during the summer season. The fruits and vegetables are sold on local market by the family members. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Natia requested credit for renovation of the greenhouse. She plans to change the existing plastic, as it is already torn and can’t keep the needed temperature. Also, part of the credit will be used for the purchase of onions for seeding.
