After the renovation, the needed temperature will be maintained in the greenhouse and the family will get a quality harvest, which will be sold at a favorable price. The family will use the anticipated income to cover daily expenses for food, clothes etc.

loans.use: to purchase plastic for the family's greenhouse renovation and onions for seeding

loans.name: Y

texts.en:
Y and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 52 and has three children: one son and two daughters. Y and her husband have been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of their house for the past six years. They sell a variety of basic goods, such as sugar, confectioneries and basic household necessities. 

Y would like to borrow money to expand her business by purchasing a greater variety and quantity of foods and basic goods to stock her general store. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying a variety of basic goods (sugar, confectionery, household necessities)

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 29-year-old single man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He is an electrician and he earns a living by repairing broken televisions and selling electrical equipment to customers in his community. 

He would like to take a loan to buy old DVD players, speakers and televisions in order to repair and sell them. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy old DVD players, speakers, and televisions to repair and sell.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 54 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет средне специальное образование, медсестра. По специальности Назокат работает уже 10 лет. Кроме того в свободное от работы время она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Назокат берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа швейной машинки.
texts.en: Nazokat lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 54 years old, married and has four children.  She has a secondary specialized education and is a nurse.  She has been working as a nurse for ten years.  Besides this work, Nazokat is involved in sewing national dresses in her free time.  She fulfills her orders at home.  Nazokat has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Fauzia Mvembo

texts.en: Fauzia is a married woman. She has a son who is 3 years old. She describes herself to be a good listener, obedient, and transparent. She operates a hairdressing salon where she provides hair care services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located near a railway station. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of security in the market centre. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to purchase hair care equipment and products. Her business goal is to relocate the business closer to the town centre to increase the number of customers within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to employ people as her business expands.

loans.use: To purchase hair care equipment and products

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 54 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. They live in H. Chi Minh City. She supports her family through the income she earns from her store that occupies the front of her house, which she has been running for 16 years. Her store sells a small variety of goods. 

She intends to take a loan to buy a larger variety of different goods, such as basic foods, to stock her store and better meet her customers' needs. She hopes her business would run smoothly and help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married, and all of her children are attending school. Her husband builds houses. Agnes has a food store; she sells beans, sorghum, maize, etc. She has been running this business for four years. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She needs a loan to buy more bananas, beans and cassava. She will use the profits to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy food that she will sell in her store.

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai is a 43-year-old married man. He lives with three children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a merchant. 

Tai earns an income to support his family by selling gas tanks to people in his community. He has done this for the past 11 years. He intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of gas tanks from different suppliers to better meet his customers' needs.

He hopes that his business will go well and provide him with enough income to stabilize his living conditions and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy gas tanks to sell

loans.name: Kevin Kyazo

texts.en: Kevin is a single man. He describes himself to be cheerful and kind. He operates a second hand clothing store where he sells trousers for men and women, and skirts for women. He has been involved in this business for one year. He describes his biggest business challenges to be sourcing new stock and staying familiar with fashion trends. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to increase the stock for the store. His business goal is to improve his business premises within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have more than one outlet to sell his products.

loans.use: To increase his stock of second hand clothes

loans.name: Hukumatulo

texts.ru: Хукуматуло житель района Фархор. Ему 69 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу, такси. Он занимается развозкой людей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Hukumatulo lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 69 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker. Hukumatulo provides a taxi service.  He transports people and has been involved in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a single man who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business, operating from home to the market. Omar faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to add to his savings to purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 47, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a general store in front of her house for the past 12 years. Hong lives with her two sons and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hong sells many kinds of products in her general store such as candies, snack foods, detergents, soaps, and beverages. Hong requires a loan to buy a range of different products in bulk for her general store. This will allow her to restock her store at a lower price and increase the range of products that she offers to customers. She hopes that this will attract additional customers and increase the income of her business.

She hopes that through the loan, she will be abL. to generate sufficient additional income to further expand her business, improve her family's living conditions and save money for her sons' education fees.

loans.use: To buy a range of different products (candies, snack foods, detergents, etc.) in bulk.

loans.name: Nancy Achieng

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has two children between 3.5 and 7 years old. She operates an electronics retail store where she sells electronic devices, speakers and DVD players. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase additional devices such as TVs to sell. Her business goal is to transform the business into a wholesale enterprise within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to venture into an electronic sales dealership of respected companies such as Sony, LG and Samsung.

loans.use: To purchase additional devices such as TVs to sell

loans.name: Loi

texts.en:
Loi is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her son and husband. Her husband is a turner. 

Loi earns an income by selling beverages in front of her house. She has done this business for 20 years. Loi needs a loan to provide her with capital to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages to serve her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to serve her customers.

loans.name: Theonest

texts.en:
Theonest is single. He is a rice farmer and has been doing rice farming for the past two years. His parents taught him how to grow rice. He will use the Kiva loan to pay for labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor on his rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 37-year-old widowed woman with three children: two sons and one daughter. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For eight years, Phuong has earned an income to support her family by selling basic goods such as rice cakes, instant noodles, snack foods, shampoos, soaps and soft drinks from the front of her house. Phuong would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of foods and goods so that she can meet the diverse needs of her customers. She believes that this will help her attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. 

Phuong hopes that through this loan, she will earn a higher income and be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy food and basic goods, such as rice cakes, instant noodles, and household items to sell

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc is a 39-year-old single woman who lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Truc earns an income to support her family by running a food stall in front of her house. She has been running her food business for the past 19 years.

Truc would like to receive a loan to buy new furniture for her food stall and buy more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and set aside some savings to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her food stall and more food to sell

loans.name: Atamurod

texts.ru: Атамурод житель района Хамадони. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а его сын уехал в Российскую Федерацию на заработки. Сам Атамурод более 20 лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этом ему помогает жена. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Atamurod lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 54 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker, and son left to go to the Russian Federation for work.  Atamurod has been involved in animal husbandry for over 20 years.  He breeds livestock for future sale.  His wife helps him in this business. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ardan Duba

texts.en: Ardan is a 39-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is three years old. He describes himself as innovative, creative, persistent, and independent. He operates a mobile phone store and cyber café where he sells mobile phones, phone accessories and provides internet, typing and printing services. He has been involved in this business for seven years and employs three staff members. His business is located in a commercial area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of inputs and electricity. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to purchase more phone accessories and computers. His business goal is to have many chains all over town within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to support his wife as she becomes educated so that she can be employed and earn a living for the family as well.

loans.use: To purchase more phone accessories and computers

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga lives in the village of Kutiri, Khoni District, West Georgia. She is 52 years old and lives with her family: her husband Valerian, 34 years old, her son and mother-in-law (retired). The only source of income for the family is their agricultural business. They have three milk cows. Olga produces and sells on average 100 kg of cheese at the local market. Along with the dairy farm, the family has two pigs and they sell approximately 24 piglets during the year. The total monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, including the pensions of Valerian and his mother. 

Olga requested credit for construction of a greenhouse. Her family members will grow various vegetables during winter in the greenhouse. It will be used in the summer for growing tomatoes.  Her new business initiative will give additional income to the family. Olga plans to reinvest it in the same business for the first couple of years, to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh, 45, lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two daughters and her husband is a driver. 

Linh runs a store selling drinks and kids' toys in front of her house. She has done this for five years. The income generated by her shop covers all the family's expenses. 

She plans to take a loan to buy more toys and beverages to better serve her customers in the local community. She hopes that by expanding her shop, she will attract more customers. She also hopes that this will increase her income and will enable her to better support her family.

loans.use: To buy more toys and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Vivi

texts.en: Nancy is a single woman. She has three children ranging from 6 to 13 years old. She describes herself as social and she likes sharing ideas. She operates a retail kiosk where she sells bread, soda, biscuits, water, sweets, soap and paper bags. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located inside a county bus terminal and her primary customers are travelers boarding vehicles within the county bus terminal. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add Coca Cola products to her business. Her business goal is to open a shop and more kiosks within her town within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children to the graduate level.

loans.use: To buy Coca Cola products to add to her business

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Min City. Her husband works as a plumber. 

Trang has been running a coffee shop for 10 years. She plans to use the loan to buy a greater range and quantity of coffee and beverages to sell in her shop.

Trang hopes that through the loan, she will be able to generate additional income to reinvest in her shop and adequately cover her family's living expenses.

loans.use: To buy more coffee and beverages to sell

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with six children. Five of her children attend school and one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a business selling second hand clothes at retail to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she has a food stall business, which contributes to her other source of income. Umazi dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a resident and a farmer in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. He is age 29 and has been in farming for six years with his produce of milk going to the local market. He currently works with one farmhand. He is married with three children.

Micah has made a loan request for 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase a dairy cow to boost his dairy business. He says he wants to own at least two pedigree cows for the business in the future. He says the business will help him pay for his children's education.

He reiterates that lack of animal feed remains the major challenge for the dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a turner.

Loan earns an income to support her family by running a noodle stall in front of her house. She has been running her noodle business for the past five years.

She would like to receive a loan to repair her food stall and buy more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her food stall and buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Bintimohamed

texts.en:
Bintimohamed is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling clothes at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of clothes. Bintimohamed dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of Khanga’s and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a businesswoman who is 53 years old and has six children. For the last four years, she has been selling clothes to earn a living. She works hard in her business to meet her family's needs. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Savriya

texts.ru: Саврия проживает в районе Рудаки. Она вдова. Ей 55 лет. У нее 5 детей. Ее дети имеют собственный бизнес. Сама Саврия имеет торговую точку на рынке, где продает женское нижнее белье. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 30 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Savriya lives in the Rudaki district.  She is 55 years old, a widow and has five children.  Her children have their own business.  Savriya has a retail outlet at the market, where she sells women's undergarments.  She has been involved in this business for 30 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Atakola Women's Group

texts.en:
The "parable of the talents" teaches that most people lack the confidence to do something because they are afraid of failure. 32-year-old Rose, a stickler of sorts for diligence, does not by any means look like she is like such people.

Her seven year-old pharmacy business is slowly establishing a "blue chip" reputation. Year in, Year out, the prospects of her business are looking brighter. On the strength of her good delivery of service, the ambitious mother of three has rode high on success. Rose set the ball rolling in her business on the heels of the completion of her studies. She majored in nursing.

Week in, week out, her business generates sales returns to the tune of 203,000 Ugandan shillings. Rose says she will bank on this Kiva loan money to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny nació en la ciudad de Limatambo a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.  Actualmente, Yenny vive en la ciudad del Cusco  y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en un colegio de la comunidad de Wilcapata en el nivel inicial, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la elaboracion de artesanía como por ejemplo platería y tejidos. En esta oportunidad Yenny requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo lana y alambres de plata. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Yenny was born in the city of Limatambo, which is 30 minutes from the city of Cusco, and is also where she works.  She is a teacher, and teaches the entry level students at a high school in the Wilcapata community.  In her free hours, she works making handicrafts, for example silverwork and weaving.

Yenny is currently requesting the loan to buy materials such as wool and silver wire.

The "Salud" ("Health") Communal Bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (in Peru).  Cusco is well-known for being an area with a lot of tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy materials for her crafts, for example wool and silver wire.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga nació en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 35 años de edad.  Actualmente, Olga vive en la misma ciudad donde nació  y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es licenciada en administración de empresas y trabaja en la municipalidad de San Sebastián en el área de rentas. Ya son cuatro años que trabaja en la municipalidad  y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Olga requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para pagar sus cuotas de la maestria que esta estudiando. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Olga was born in the city of Cusco, and is 35 years old.  Today, Olga lives in the same city where she was born, and where she also works.  She has a degree in business administration, and works for the San Sebastián municipality in the revenues department.  She has been working for the municipality for four years now, and it's going very well for her.

On this occasion, Olga is requesting a loan for personal use; specifically, she will use it to pay her fees for the Master's degree for which she is studying.

The "Salud" ("Health") Communal Bank meets monthly in the city off Cusco (in Peru).  Cusco is well-known for being an area with a lot of tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it is the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to pay her fees for the Masters degree for which she is studying.

loans.name: Agripino

texts.es:
Agripino nació en la ciudad de Urubamba, tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Agripino vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, él es docente y trabaja en la comunidad de Wilcapata, él también se dedica a la crianza de animales como por ejemplo cuyes. En esta oportunidad Agripino requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para sus cuyes. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Agripino was born in the city of Urubamba. He is 39 years old and he and his partner have two children. Currently, Agripino lives and works in the city of Cuzco. He is a teacher in the Wilcapata neighborhood. He also raises small animals like guinea pigs. Agripino needs this loan to buy feed for his guinea pigs.
The Salud village bank meets monthly in Cuzco, Peru, a city known for its vibrant tourism economy and for the traditional Inti Raymi festival held each year on the June solstice. Nearby is Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy feed for his guinea pigs.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: El señor Moisés, se dedica a la producción de leche y también trabaja en la alcaldía como tractorista y sus hijos le ayudan con labores agrícolas. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar un par de vacas lecheras para así poder aumentar la producción de leche y sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz;  es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la Primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en: Moisés is a dairy farmer and also works for the city as a tractor operator; his children help him with his farming chores.  He needs the loan to buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and income.  He lives in his own house located in Achacahi, La Paz Department.  He’s married and has two children.  This is the first time he’s requested a loan in IMPRO and in Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is from the village of Chkhenishi. He is 39 years old and married. Ramaz lives with his family; his wife Ketevan, 20-year-old son and 17-year-old daughter. His son is a student in high school and his daughter goes to school. 

Ramaz and Ketevan lead the family's agricultural business and have 6 milk cows. Ketevan produces and sells on average 80 kg of traditional West Georgian cheese per month. The family also grows maize and soybeans on the family-owned 2.5 hectare land. Part of the harvested corn is used for feeding the cows and the other part is sold locally. Total average income of the family is 750 Laris per month. 

Ramaz requested credit to develop a fish farm. He will purchase local species of fish and grow them near a dam. Starting from the spring season, the fish will start to spawn and start intensively selling. Part of the credit will be also used to purchase feed for the fish. 

Ramaz expects that development of the fish farm will raise the income of the family. Part of the increase in income will be reinvested in the same business and the other part will be used for financing his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fish and feed for a fish farm.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a business man, age 31 and single. For the last eight years, he has been selling clothes. He also practices dairy farming for more income. He has employed two people to help him to manage his business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over a year, he has operated a photocopying business, making copies for his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the 10,000 KES, he wants to purchase printing paper for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase printing paper for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for rice farming.

loans.name: Elizabeth Mumbe

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 33-year-old married woman. She describes herself as patient, innovative, industrious, and inquisitive. She operates a tailoring and dressmaking business where she sells skirts, suits, blouses, children's clothes, curtains and pillows. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a clothing market in a commercial area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as having insufficient funds to purchase clothing. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more clothing for ladies and children. Her business goal is to be a distributor of materials within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have children and be able to build a family home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for ladies and children.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La señora Emma, se dedica a la producion de leche y su esposo es trabaja en la ciudad como mesero en un restaurant. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar  un par de vacas lecheras para poder aumentar su producción de leche y de esta manera mejorar los ingresos de la familia. Emma vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz;  está casada y tiene un hijo. Es la Primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en: Emma is a dairy farmer and her husband works as a waiter in a restaurant.  She needs the loan to buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and thus improve family income.  Emma lives in her own house located in Achacachi, La Paz Department.  She’s married and has a son.  This is the first time she’s asked for a loan in IMPRO and in Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a hardworking 29-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has two children. For the last four years, she has been weaving mats and baskets. She really thanks God for giving her talent in crafts because she is able to earn a living for her family. In the next five years, she wants to build her own home. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy beads and thread for weaving.

loans.use: to buy beads and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wire, bulbs, regulators, and sockets for his electronics business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two hand carts for water distribution.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food and clothing for the family

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is the father of six children. He has been growing rice for the past 30 years. He has been taught rice farming by his parents. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and later for harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labour costs during rice production

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking business woman. She is 32 and married.

For the last two years, she has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. She also does tailoring to supplement her income.  She has retained her business because of her hard work and determination.

In the next 5 years, she wants to buy a plot of land. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Pacifico

texts.es: El señor Pacifico, trabaja como chofer  y está afiliado a uno de los tantos sindicatos de choferes de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor para el microbús que tiene y con el que trabaja, para continuar ofreciendo transporte a la gente de la ciudad y en condiciones óptimas. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Gran Poder  en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene tres  hijos. Pacífico es cliente antiguo de IMPRO desde el año  2007 y esta será la segunda vez que desea que su crédito sea canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Pacífico works as a driver and is affiliated with one of the many transportation syndicates in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to buy an engine for the minibus he owns and that he works with to continue to offer transportation for the people in the city in the best possible conditions.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Gran Poder zone.  He’s married and has three children.  Pacífico is a longstanding client of IMPRO since 2007 and this will be the second time he wants his loan channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his minibus.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela nació en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 50 años de edad. Actualmente, Adela vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella tiene un negocio que consiste en la venta de golosinas en una pequeña kiosko. En esta oportunidad Adela requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería como por ejemplo dulces y galletas. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Adela was born in the city of Cuzco and is 50 years old. Currently, Adela lives and works in the city of her birth. She has a business selling sweets from a little stall. Adela needs this loan to buy more product, such as cookies and candies.

The Salud village bank meets monthly in Cuzco, Peru, a city known for its vibrant tourism economy and for the traditional Inti Raymi festival held each year on the June solstice. Nearby is Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy more product, such as cookies and candies.

loans.name: Nacianzena

texts.es:
Nacianzena nació en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco y tiene 49 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Nacianzena vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en la comunidad de Wilcapata en el nivel primario. Ya son 17 años que se dedica a la enseñanza y le va muy bien, ella también se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. En esta oportunidad Nacianzena requiere el préstamo para aumentar jaulas  y cuyes. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Nacianzena was born in the city of Calca, in the department of Cuzco. She is 49 years old and the single mother of two children. Currently, she lives and works in the city of Cuzco. She is an elementary school teacher in the Wilcapata neighborhood. She has been teaching for 17 years, and it's going very well. She also raises small animals like guinea pigs. Nacianzena needs this loan to buy more cages and guinea pigs.

The Salud village bank meets monthly in Cuzco, Peru, a city known for its vibrant tourism economy and for the traditional Inti Raymi festival held each year on the June solstice. Nearby is Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy more cages and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is a father and he has been a farmer for the past 25 years. He has 3 children. He learned this type of farming from his parents. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and later for harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for rice farming

loans.name: Hermila

texts.es:
Hermila nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 51 años D. edad, ella es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene seis hijos. Actualmente, Hermila vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donD. desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta D. peluches, ella viaja dos veces a la semana a la ciudad D. Puno y al país D. Bolivia a comprar sus productos, ella venD. sus productos en la feria sabatina  “El Baratillo” en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Hermila requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo peluches. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Hermila was born in the department of Cuzco, and is 51 years old.  She is married, and has six children from the marriage.  Hermila currently lives in the city of Cuzco, where she has her business activities.  She sells items maD. of plush, traveling twice weekly to the city of Puno, and to Bolivia to buy her products.  She sells her products in the “El Baratillo” Saturday market, in the city of Cuzco.  She has been engaged in this business for two years, and things are going well for her.  Hermila now requires a loan to buy more merchandise, such as, for example, items maD. of plush.

The “Salud” Communal Bank meets monthly in the city of Cuzco (Peru).  Cuzco is known as a heavy business and tourist area, and because of the Inti Raymi traditional festival.  Also because one of the seven wonders of the world is found there:  Machu Picchu.

loans.use: buy more merchandise, such as, for example, items made of plush.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 48 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Maria Elena vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Ebel. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Maria Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, lápiz labial y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Maria Elena was born in Cusco department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage.  Maria Elena currently lives in the city of Cusco and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Her business is selling Ebel-brand beauty products.  She has been in this business for five years and it is going very well.  On this occasion, Maria Elena needs a loan to buy more cosmetics such as perfume, lipstick and other products.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: St Joseph Group

texts.fr: ST JOSEPH est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Antoinette. Les membres du groupe résident dans la même localité. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Antoinette est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un plombier du nom de Gracien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Antoinette et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Antoinette a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Il y a environs quatre ans que Antoinette vend des sous-vêtements dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Antoinette vend du riz et de l'huile végétale. Antoinette s’approvisionne au Bénin. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Antoinette et à aux autres membres du groupe ST JOSEPH, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
ST JOSEPH is a group made up of three persons whose representative (the one raising her hand in the photo) is named Antoinette. The members of the group live in the same locality. Wishing to grow their working capital, this group is asking for a loan for the third time from ALIDé. 

Antoinette is 30 and is married to a plumber named Gracien. The couple has two children; both are in school and living under their roof. Antoinette and her husband share in supporting their family. Antoinette did not continue after primary school. She has been selling underwear in her district for about four years. Secondarily, she sells rice and vegetable oil. She buys her merchandise in Bénin. This third loan will certainly permit Antoinette and the two other members of the ST JOSEPH group to lift the level of their businesses and grow their clientele and their income.

loans.use: to buy underwear, rice, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking business woman. She 34 years old, married and has two children who are still in school.

For the last seven years, she has been running a wholesale shop to bring up her family. She has worked hard to grow her business. Her desire is to open a supermarket within five years. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy soda and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy soda and maize flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruit for making juice for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his union membership fees.

loans.name: Guillermina Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel nació en la ciudad de Hidroeléctrica – Machupicchu del departamento del Cusco y tiene 33 años de edad, ella es separada y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 12 año que Isabel vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella trabaja como asistente administrativa  en una clínica odontológica donde desempeña su labor de manera excelente, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. En esta oportunidad Isabel requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, lápiz labial y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in the city of Hidroeléctrica-Machupicchu, in Cusco department.  She is 33 years old, separated, and has two children.  Isabel has been living in the city of Cusco for 12 years and this is where she carries out her business activites.  She works as an administrative assistant in a dental clinic and carries out her work in an excellent manner.  In her free time, she sells cosmetics.  On this occasion, Isabel needs a loan to buy more cosmetics such as, for example, perfume, lipsticks and other products.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene, the father of two children, has been a rice farmer for the past 15 years. He learnt this type of farming from his parents. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and, lastly, harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid 20s, is single with one small child. She has had a stall place for one year now where she sells sodas, juice, water and bites (like small cakes). She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to sell mandazi (fried bread similar to donuts), vitumbuwa (a breakfast dish), small ice cubes, sodas, juice, water, bites and for household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase her stock of sodas, juice, water, bites, mandanzi and boiled sweet potatoes. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Twitange" which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of sodas, juice, water, bites (small cakes), mandanzi (like donuts), and boiled sweet potatoes

loans.name: Clement

texts.en: Clement is a hardworking businessman aged 32. He is married and has three children who are still in school. He does photography to earn a living.  He also owns a barber shop which earns him extra income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business into wholesale. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a camera.

loans.use: To buy a camera

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is the father of four children, the eldest of whom is 25 years old. He has been a rice farmer for the past 28 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lastly, harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario es dueño de dos tiendas de llantas para movilidades. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más llantas ya que cada día sus clientes aumentan y necesita un mayor stock de la mercadería. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y  tiene dos hijos. Esta es la tercera vez que usa a Kiva para su solicitud de crédito.
texts.en:
Mario is the owner of two vehicle tire stores. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more tires because each day he sees an increase in the number of customers. Therefore, he needs to stock up on more merchandise. He lives in his own home in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. Mario is married and has two children.

This is the third time that his loan request has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase tires to sell.

loans.name: Duharanire Kwitezimbere / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Duharanire Kwitezimbere/RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « travailler beaucoup pour son propre développement ». Il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de secondaire. 

Emmanuel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 


Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver peu d’espace et récolter une grande quantité de riz en utilisant des engrais chimiques. Dans les prochaines années, Emmanuel voudrait être le meilleur cultivateur de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit de satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of the group loan Duharanire Kwitezimbere/RSZ which means "work hard for your own development". Emmanuel is single and stopped school two years after high school. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay for the workforce to cultivate rice. 
To grow his business, his strategy is to cultivate small space and to harvest large quantity of rice thanks to the use of fertilizers. In the next years, Emmanuel would like to be the best rice farmer in his valley. With the profits, he plans to fulfill his needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay the workforce to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Marie Providence

texts.en:
Marie Providence, who is single, is a rice farmer. She has been doing rice farming for the past four years. She was taught rice farming by her parents.

She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and, lastly, in harvesting activities.

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Favian

texts.es: El señor Favian, es productor lechero y su esposa es artesana. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera para así aumentar la producción de leche y a la vez sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la localidad de Cota Cota  en la provincia Los Andes en el departamento de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Favian is a milk producer and his wife is an artisan. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase both his milk production and his income. He lives in his own home in the town of Cota Cota in Los Andes Province in the Department of La Paz. Favian is married and has two children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Samson has operated a poultry keeping business, selling as retail and from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing poultry feed. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan he wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is 31 years old and has five children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is two. They are all in school.  She sells clothes such as shirts, skirts, pants, etc. She has run this store for the last seven years.  This business has allowed her to send her children to school. She would like a loan to buy more clothes in order to grow her business. She will use the profits to build a bigger home.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in her clothing store

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a clothes materials business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of competition from other cloth sellers in the area. Omar dreams of establishing a stall to sell clothes for resale.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mahugnon-Pahou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON-PAHOU est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin.C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie est âgée de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. Marie est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Félix. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui sont à leur charge. Marie vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges de la maison, grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Marie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis trois ans, Marie vend des produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, divers conserves, huile végétale, sucre, etc.) à son domicile. Marie achète ses produits dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Marie sollicite un troisième crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON-PAHOU. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHUGNON-PAHOU group is made up of three persons who all live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. It's the third time that this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé, in order to grow their businesses. The representative of the group, Marie, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

 Marie is 51 and lives in Bénin. She is married to a retailer named Félix. The couple have four children who are all enrolled in school and for whom they are responsible. Marie helps her husband by sharing with him the responsibility for the household expenses, thanks to the income from her business. 

 Marie never went to school. For three years she has been selling various items (pasta, different canned foods, vegetable oil, sugar, etc.) out of her home. She buys her merchandise in one of the markets in  Bénin. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her income, Marie is requesting a third loan, together with the other members of the MAHUGNON-PAHOU group. Their first two loans have been correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy various items (sugar, tinned goods, pasta, vegetable oil, etc.)

loans.name: Ricardo Arturo

texts.es:
Ricardo Arturo tiene 31 años de edad, es casado vive con la esposa y con los tres hijos de tres, ocho,diesiceis años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La V.R.C se llama 1º DE MAYO, se encuentra ubicada en la ciudadela primero de mayo, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas a 30 minutos de la oficia esta ventanilla se dedica a labores comerciales, agricultura, crianza de animales, negocios propios y empleos.
 
Ricardo Arturo  trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una institución publica, además se dedica al comercio de ropa. Las compras las realiza en Guayaquil y las Vende en Ventanas.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar ropa y artículos de bazar. El crédito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar los ingresos al momento de vender la mercadería. Enfrenta desafíos como la falta de dinero para invertir en el negocio. Su sueño es mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia y dar buena atención a los clientes.

Le gusta trabajar, salir con la familia, hacer deporte y ver televisión.
texts.en:
Ricardo Arturo is 31 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The '1º de Mayo' community bank is located in Primero de Mayo community, in Ventanas canton, 30 minutes from our office.  The members of the bank work in commerce, farming, animal raising, their own businesses and jobs.

Ricardo Arturo works as a security guard in a public institution.  He also sells clothes.  He makes his purchases in Guayaquil and makes his sales in Ventanas.

Ricardo Arturo is requesting this loan to buy clothes and miscellaneous goods. The loan will help him to improve his income when he sells the merchandise. He faces challenges such as a lack of money to invest in his business.  His dream is to improve his family's life style and to provide his customers with a good service.

Ricardo Arturo enjoys working, going out with his family, taking part in sports and watching television - especially sports.

loans.use: to buy clothes and miscellaneous goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a bull for slaughtering and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tissues, soap, chloride, and cartons of cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Lady Johanna

texts.es:
Lady Johana tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera tiene un hijo vive con el hijo,  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

La V.R.C se llama 1º DE MAYO, se encuentra ubicada en la ciudadela primero de mayo, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas a 30 minutos de la oficia esta ventanilla se dedica a labores comerciales, agricultura, crianza de animales, negocios propios y empleos.

Lady Johana se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosméticos al por menor. Las compras las realiza en Guayaquil y las Vende en Ventanas.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar ropa de adulto y niños y cosméticos para mujer. El crédito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar los ingresos al vender la mercadería. Enfrenta desafíos como la falta de dinero para invertir en el negocio y la competencia. Su sueño es darle una buena educación al hijo y darle lo que necesite.

Le gusta tener amigos y pasar tiempo con el hijo.
texts.en:
Lady Johana is 26 years old.  She is single and lives with her son in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The ' 1º de Mayo' community bank is located in Primero de Mayo community, in Ventanas canton, 30 minutes from our office.  The members of this bank work in commerce, farming, animal raising, their own businesses and jobs.

Lady Johana sells clothes retail.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and makes her sales in Ventanas.

Lady Johana is requesting this loan to buy clothing for adults and children.  She faces challenges such as a lack of money to invest in her business.  Her dream is to provide her child with an education and provide him with what he needs.

In her free time, Lady Johana enjoys having friends and spending time with her son.

loans.use: to buy clothing for adults and children

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenges of seasonality and competition in his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of sugar, rice and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, rice and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María, trabaja como profesora además de ser artesana. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (estuco, pinturas, enchufes para electricidad, etc.) ya que realizará el acabado de su casa que ha estado construyendo por fases. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Las Lomas en la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y  tiene un hijo. Maria es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006 y esta es la tercera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva, por su excelente historial de pagos y las condiciones del crédito que mejoran cuando el crédito se coloca a través de los financiadores de Kiva.
texts.en:
María works as a teacher and she’s also a craftswoman.  She needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies (stucco, paint, electrical sockets, etc.) because she will finish building her house in stages.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Las Lomas zone.  She’s married and has a son.  

María has been an IMPRO client since 2006 and this is the third time her loan will be channeled through Kiva because of her excellent payment history and because the loan conditions improve when the loan is placed through Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy stucco, paint and electrical sockets.

loans.name: Verena

texts.en: Verena is married with seven children who are aged between one and 15 years old. Her husband works in construction. She has a restaurant that she has been running for seven years. She sells many different African dishes. The restaurant has enabled her to care for her children. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, beans, potatoes and vegetables. With the profits she wishes to expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs e.g. rice, sugar, beans, potatoes, vegetables, etc. to cook in her restaurant

loans.name: Twitezimbere Zone 2 Group

texts.fr:
Adrien fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere Zone 2. Le nom du groupe signifie « développer nous même ». Il est marié avec 3 personnes en charge. 

Adrien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 


Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver peu d’espace et récolter une grande quantité de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Adrien voudrait devenir fournisseur de riz dans divers coins du pays. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses frères et sœurs et s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Adrien is a member of the group loan Twitezimbere Zone 2 which means "develop ourselves". He is married with 3 people in charge. Adrien is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB and he wants to use it to purchase fertilizers and to pay the workforce to cultivate rice. 
To grow his business, his strategy is to cultivate small space and to harvest large quantity of rice. In the next years, Adrien would like to become a rice supplier in different areas of the country. With the profits, he plans to give education to his younger brothers and sisters.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to pay the workforce to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Enagnon 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON 1 est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Louise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Louise est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Antonin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble et le couple se partage les diverses charges de la maison. Louise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Afin de s’impliquer activement dans les charges du ménage, Louise prépare depuis quatre ans de la nourriture (riz et haricot), qu'elle vend à sa clientèle de façon ambulante. Louise s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Louise sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 1, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
The ENAGNON 1 group is made up of four persons who live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. This is the second time that this group has requested a loan from ALIDé, in order to grow their businesses. The representative of the group, Louise, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

 Louise is 31 and is married to a driver named Antonin. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school and living under their roof. The family all live together and the couple share in supporting the household. 

Louise didn't go to school. So as to take an active role in supporting her family, she has been cooking and selling food (rice and beans) for four years. She sells it on foot, door to door, to her clientele. She buys her supplies in  Bénin. Hoping to be able to satisfy her clientele and in order to grow her sales and her income, Louise is requesting a second loan, together with the other members of the ENAGNON 1 group.

loans.use: to buy rice, dried beans, vegetable oil and condiments for sauces.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre is a married father of three children. The children are not yet in school.  He sells foodstuffs such as bananas, potatoes, salt, cooking oil, and fruit. He has run this business for the last seven years which has helped him to meet the needs of his family. He needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs, and with the profits he will begin building a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell in his store

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana María, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes pues tiene una tienda. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital y comprar  arroz, fideo y conservas para surtir la tienda y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a su clientela. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en  casa propia la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de  Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ana Maria ya accedió a un crédito el año 2010 y ahora será la primera vez que requiere que Kiva ayude para conseguir el fondeo necesario.
texts.en: Ana María sells groceries because she has a store.  She needs the loan to increase capital and buy rice, noodles and canned goods to stock the store and have a wider variety available for her customers.  This activity is the source of income she has to cover her expenses.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Irpavi zone.  She’s married and has a son.  Ana María already had a loan in 2010 and now this will be the first time she needs Kiva’s help to get the necessary funding.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent has a three-year-old child. He is married to a woman who works as a farmer. He runs a store that sells shoes, clothes, scholastic material, and school bags. He has run this shop for the last seven years.  Vincent needs a loan to buy more goods during the rainy season when prices are low to capitalize on the profits when business picks up.  With the profits, he would like to pay his child's school fees and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and educational supplies for his store

loans.name: Abunzubumwe / Kzr Group

texts.fr:
Fiacre fait partie du groupe Abunzubumwe/KZR. Le nom du groupe signifie « unir les gens ». Fiacre est né au Rwanda. Il est marié avec 5 enfants de 3 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés.

Fiacre est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimiques, cultiver peu d’espace et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Fiacre voudrait devenir fournisseur dans différentes régions et dans les pays voisins. Avec les profits, il prévoit de nourrir et éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fiacre is a member of Abunzubumwe / KZR Group, which means "uniting people". He was born in Rwanda. He is married and the father of five children, aged 3 to 12. Three of his children attend school.

Fiacre is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

His growth strategy consists in using chemical fertilizers, cultivating a small acreage and yielding a good harvest. In the years to come Fiacre would like to become a supplier in several regions of Rwanda and in the adjacent countries. He will use his profit to provide food and education to his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela nació en la ciudad Cusco y tiene 33 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Gabriela vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella es cocinera y trabaja en el comedor nacional de la ciudad del Cusco, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde hace 3 años en el comedor nacional y le va muy bien, ella los días sábados y domingos se dedica  a la venta de pasamanería. En esta oportunidad Gabriela requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo betunes, jaboncillos, pasadores y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Gabriela was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 33 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.

Gabriela currently lives in the city in which she was born and this is where she carries out her business activities.  She is a cook and works in the national restaurant, in the city of Cusco.  She has been working there from Monday to Friday for the past three years and is doing very well.  On Saturdays and Sundays she sells miscellaneous goods.  On this occasion, Gabriela needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as shoe polish, soap, shoelaces, etc.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as shoe polish, soap, shoelaces, etc.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es:
Jose Domingo nació en la ciudad Cusco y tiene 47 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Jose Domingo vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, él tiene una pequeña imprenta en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Jose Domingo requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como papel y tinta. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Jose Domingo was born in the city of Cusco.  He is 47 years old, married, and has two children from his marriage.  He currently lives in the city in which he was born and this is where he carries out his business activities.  Jose Domingo has a small printing business in the city of Cusco.  He has been in this business for several years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy more work materials such as paper and ink.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more work materials such as paper and ink

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of competition in his business. Abdalla dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan which he is requesting, he wants to add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.fr:
Dodo est une femme âgé(e) de 60ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire retraité. Elle a 05 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 35 ans et le dernier a 13 ans.  
Dodo travaille comme revendeuse de céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) et des ignames depuis 1975. Elle sert tout le monde à la maison et au marché. 
Dodo a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames et des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Dodo voudrait faire prospérer son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut être stable financièrement.
texts.en:
Dodo, age 60, is married to a retired soldier. She has five children, out of whom one attends school. The firstborn is 35, the youngest one is 13. Dodo has been selling cereals (corn, millet, sorghum) and yams since 1975. She serves a wide variety of customer at her home and at the market.

Dodo is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy yams and cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to make her business thrive. She says that, thanks to her profits, she wants to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cereals and yams

loans.name: Nancy Nicanora

texts.es:
Nancy nació en el departamento de Ilo y tiene 54 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene seis hijos. Desde hace 40 años que radica en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de bebes. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Nancy requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo ropa de bebes. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Nancy was born in Ilo department.  She is 54 years old, married, and has six children from her marriage.  She has been living in the city of Cusco for 40 years and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Nancy sells baby clothes.  She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well.  On this occasion, Nancy needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as, for example, baby clothes.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as baby clothes

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Mónica nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 43 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Actualmente,  Mónica vive en la misma ciudad donde y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza.
