It is comprised of the following members: Antonia and Teresa, who will use their loan to purchase mangoes, tomatoes, peppers, onions, apples and coriander; Porfiria, who will purchase wholesale perfumes, deodorants and lotions; Araceli, who will purchase women's, men's and children's shoes; Angela, who will purchase frying pans, ironing boards and kitchen utensil sets; Reyna, who will purchase thread and fabric to sew; Guadalupe, who will purchase spare parts, lubricating oil and tires for his auto repair shop; Petra, who will purchase sweets, "pelones" (a type of candy), popsicles and cracklings; and Marciana who will purchase wholesale shoes.
Antonia is 61 years old and lives with her husband in a common law marriage. She has seven adult children. She sells fruits and vegetables and has requested the loan in order to purchase tomatoes, green beans, peppers, onions, apples and mangoes. She started her business four years ago by purchasing goods little by little, using what her husband gave her for expenses. With the loan from Kiva and Fundación Realidad she purchased more fruits and vegetables.
Her business is important, because she enjoys selling and making money in order to help with the cost of her grandson's education. Her grandson lives with her. As for her granddaughter, she is able to help her by giving her fruits and vegetables. Hers is a traveling business - she goes out and sells her merchandise to her neighbors. Her husband and her grandson help her business by bringing her goods from the central warehouse. She likes to go out and make sales because she gets to meet new people. She uses the profits she makes from her business to pay for electricity, water and loan repayments, and to reinvest.
She plans to expand her business to include dehydrated peppers, and she believes she can achieve that with the loan she will get from Kiva and Fundación Realidad. Her hopes and dreams are to have her business grow, to become a better person, and to have her grandchildren study and get a better quality of life.
The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that "we thank you for your loans and may you continue to help us see our businesses and our families grow".

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, green beans, peppers, onions, apples and mangoes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells coal pots and pans at Abura and has done so for the past 13 years. 

She is divorced and has two children.  Her income is used to educate and feed her family.  

The loan will be used to buy more pots and pans to sell.  Additional profits will be saved and used to pay for the university-level education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more pots, and pans to sell.

loans.name: Amandina

texts.es:
Amandina nació en la provincia del Calca. Actualmente, Amandina tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Amandina vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en un colegio particular en la ciudad de Calca, ella desde hace 16 años que enseña en este colegio en el nivel primario y le va muy bien, ella también tiene un emporio en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Calca.

En esta oportunidad Amandina requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de ganado y carne de chancho. 

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Amandina was born in the province of Calca. She is currently 45 years old, married and has three children.

Amandina lives and works in the same city where she was born. She is a teacher and works at a private school in the city of Calca. She has been teaching primary education at this school for 16 years and it is going very well. She also has a shop in the Calca market.

At this time, Amandina needs a loan to buy cow and pig meat.

The "Millennium III" communal bank meets every 30 days in the city of Calca, which is in the department of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known as a tourist and commercial zone. It is also known for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and as the home of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy cow and pig meat

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Married to a driver, Hajara has three children. 

She makes palm oil for retailers.  Hajara assists her partner when it comes to taking care of their family and home. 

The loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to make more oil.  The profit will be reinvested into her small business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to make more oil.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena  ella es  casada con el señor Abelardo  y con quien procreo  cinco hijos que a un están a su  responsabilidad.

    Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y legumbres como son: chayotes, plátanos, tomate, cebolla, repollo, calabaza, entre otros  así tener surtido  su negocio,  en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido  un buen ingreso para su  hogar  ya que cuenta  con la a ayuda de su  esposo.

    Su  inspiración por esta a actividad fue su  familia  para que pueda apoyarlos con su  educación y crecimiento, así también a su esposo  para que juntos salgan adelantes.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad y el préstamo pueda ir aumentado su ganancia  para lograr ampliar más su negocio.
  
    Las persona que integran en el  grupo son las señoras: María Neófita  quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de ropas, también se integra la señora Reynalda quien  compra ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales, la señora Lorena  quien invertirá en la compra de cosméticos de la marca Avon, ambas son del grupo la esperanza.
texts.en:
Señora María Magdalena is married to Señor Abelardo with whom she has 5 children who are still under their care.

She asked for the loan to buy fruits and vegetables such as: chayote (vegetable pear), plantains, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, squash among others, to stock her business. She says that her business is doing well as it has given her a good income for the household because she has her husband's support.

Her family was her inspiration to start the business so she could support them with their education and growth, likewise her husband so that together they could get ahead.

What she most wants is for the business and the loan together to allow her to increase her profit so as to further expand her business.

The members of La Esperanza group are: María Neófita who will invest the loan in buying materials for making clothes. Señora Reynalda is also a member who buys ingredients for making tamales. Señora Lorena, another member, will invest in buying cosmetics of the Avon brand

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the palm oil business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a peddler who sells cooking utensils and plastic bowls. 

She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a farmer.  Hawa has been selling utensils for about 3 years.  

The loan will be used to buy more utensils to sell. Hawa plans to save her new profits to buy land.

loans.use: the sale of utensils.

loans.name: Dieu Plus Fort Limonade Group

texts.fr:
Amboise  est le coordinateur de son groupe Dieu plus fort.
Il n`est pas marié et il a 4 enfants.

Amboise habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Amboise  a dirigé son commerce pendant les dernières2 années.
Avant de commencer ce commerce, Amboise etait un chauffeur et de la cultive.

 Amboise voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans l`epicerie dont il vend des  divers produits

Amboise espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce

Des autres membres de sont groupe  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbonné le produits divers et cosmetologie

Amboise dit que ses défis  défi principal(s) sont les manques d,achats et trop de personnes lui ont demande le credit

Amboise dit que son but principal  est  d,avoir un  pretter plus d`argent pour obtenir un plus grand commerce avec l`aide de dieu.
texts.en:
Ambroise is the coordinator of his group called "Dieu plus fort." (God is Stronger) He is not married but he has four children. He lives in the northern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Ambroise has been running his business during the past two years. Before beginning this business, he was a driver and farmer. He would like to use his share of this loan to invest in his grocery store where he sells various products. He hopes that this loan will help him to have a bigger business.  

The other members of his group need a loan for businesses such as selling charcoal, various products, and cosmetology. 

Ambroise says that his main challenges are a lack of purchasers and too many persons who ask him for credit. He says that his principal goal is to have a little more money so as to get a bigger business with the help of god.

loans.use: to invest in various products he sells in his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain more palm fruits for the oil.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has displayed some food items she sells on a table. The food items are fresh tomatoes, onions, garden eggs (similar to eggplants), canned tomatoes, and others, which she has done for 6 years. She is a single parent taking care of three children. 

The loan, she promised, would be used to buy more food items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
Anayeli es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella tiene 23 años de edad y tiene dos niños, la mayor de 4 años la cual estudia el preescolar y un niño de un año. Ana como es conocida por sus vecinos y familiares tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace aproximadamente un año. Platica Ana que emprendió su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de los niños y para estar mas al pendiente de ellos ya que están pequeños. Anayeli pidió un crédito a la financiera para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, ella comprará azúcar, leche, frijol, detergente, cloro, pan, enlatados, pañales, servilletas, papel higiénico etc. Ana esta muy contenta por que dice que es la segunda ocasión que lo pide y que gracias a los créditos  tiene una fuente de empleo con la cual ayudar a su esposo. 
Las otras nueve integrantes del  grupo se llaman Silvia, Martha, Griselda, Laura Angélica, Blanca, Argelia, Susana, America y Karen Alejandra, ellas invertirán su crédito en una papelería, en club nutricional, tienda de ropa, antojitos mexicanos, taqueria, frutas y verduras y deposito de refrescos.
texts.en:
Anayeli is a hardworking woman. She is 23 years old and has two children. Her older child is a four-year-old preschool student and her other child is only a year old. Ana, as she is known to her neighbors and relatives, has managed a grocery store for approximately one year. She says that she started this business in order to help her husband with their children’s expenses. Ana also wants to provide more for them while they are still young. She is requesting a loan to restock her grocery store. Ana will buy sugar, milk, beans, detergent, bleach, bread, canned goods, diapers, napkins, toilet paper, and other products. She is very pleased because this is the second time she has requested a loan. Thanks to the financing, she has a source of employment by which she can help her husband.

The other nine members of the group are Silvia, Martha, Griselda, Laura Angélica, Blanca, Argelia, Susana, America, and Karen Alejandra. They will invest their loans in a stationery store, a nutritional club, a clothing store, a Mexican street food business, a taco shop, a fruit and vegetable stand, and a soft drink repository.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Дмитрий не женат. Он владеет небольшим магазином, который называется "Подарки". В магазине он продает игрушки, посуду, постельное белье, сувениры. Дмитрий унаследовал этот бизнес от родителей и занимается им около 1 года.
Несмотря на то, что бизнес хорошо поставлени и приносит стабильную прибыль, Дмитрий намерен развивать его дальше. Дмитрий просит кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку постельного белья. Этот товар имеет большой спрос, особенно в качестве подарка на свадьбу или день рождения. Полученную прибыль Дмитрий намерен инвестирвать обратно в бизнес.
texts.en: Dmitriy is not married.  He owns a small store, called "Gifts."  He sells toys, dishware, bedding and souvenirs in his store.  Dmitriy inherited this business from his parents and has been involved in it for about one year.  Despite the fact that the business is well-established and yields a stable profit, Dmitriy intends to develop it further.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia for the purchase of bedding.  This type of merchandise is in high demand, especially as a wedding or birthday gift.  Dmitriy plans to invest the resulting profit back into his business.

loans.use: to purchase bedding

loans.name: El Penjamo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María cuenta con 66 años de edad tiene cinco hijos, ella es casada su esposo se llama Miguel, él se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda de abarrotes su préstamo lo invirtió en surtir mas su negocio en la compra de refrescos, jugos, jabon, aceite, etc. ella dice que la ha beneficiado mucho ya que de ahí es de donde mantiene a su familia. A la Sra. María le gustaría que su negocio fuera más grande ya que ha si pues le daría más ganancia ella dice que más adelante lo ampliara más.
	
La Sra. María pertenece al grupo llamado penjamo el grupo está integrado por 10 personas todas son mujeres las cuales a continuación serán mencionada.

1.	La Sra. Elsa se dedica al comercio vende frutas y verduras ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de frutas y verduras  como son: manzanas, peras, plátano, jitomate, chile, cebolla, etc.
2.	la Sra. Oferdelia se dedica al comercio ella vende comida por la noche en su casa ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de insumos para elaborar su comida como son: aceite, jitomate, chile, cebolla, pollo, etc.
3.	la Sra. Nélida se dedica al comercio ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de productos como son: jabón, aceite, galletas, café, refrescos, etc.
4.	la Sra. Ana se dedica al comercio ella vende una bebida tradicional de su pueblo que se llama chilate ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza en la elaboración del chilate como son: cacao, galleta, azúcar, y leche, agua, etc.
5.	la Sra. Antonia se dedica al comercio ella compra garrafones de agua purificada para vender ella invirtió en la compra de mas garrafones para vender.
6.	la Sra. Fulgencio se dedica a vender pozole ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para hacer el pozole como son: pollo, maíz, cebolla, chile, condimento, etc.
7.	la Sra. Verónica se dedica al comercio de ropa ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas modelo de pantalones, faldas, vestidos, etc.
8.	la Sra. Ma. Félix  se dedica a vender tamales de mole, de salsa verde y  picadillo lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza como son: aceite, masa, pollo, carne, papa, zanahoria, chile, etc.
9.	la Sra. Beatriz se dedica al comercio vende antojitos lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza como son: queso, lechuga, jitomate, aceite, chile, etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is 66 years old, has 5 children, is married to Miguel, and works in the countryside.

She sells groceries in a grocery store. She will use her loan to stock her store with more sodas, juices, soap, oil, etc. She says this business has helped her maintain her family. María would like for her business to grow to make more profits. She says she will expand it in the future.

1. Mrs. Elsa sell fruits and vegetables and she will use her loan to buy more fruits and vegetables such as: apples, pears, bananas, tomatoes, chiles, onions, etc. 2. Mrs. Oferdelia sells meals at night from her home. She will use the loan to buy materials to prepare her meals such as: oil, tomatoes, chiles, poultry, etc. 3. Mrs. Nélida has a grocery store and will use her loan to buy products such as: soap, oil, cookies, coffee, sodas, etc. 4. Mrs. Ana sells a traditional beverage from her hometown called chilate. She will use her loan to buy materials she uses to make chilate such as: cocoa, cookies, sugar, milk, water, etc. 5. Mrs. Antonia sells jugs of purified water and will use the loan to buy more jugs to sell. 6. Mrs. Fulgencio sells pozole and will use the loan to buy materials to make pozole such as: poultry, maiz, onions, chiles, spices, etc. 7. Mrs. Verónica sell clothes and will use the loan to buy more pants, skirts, dresses, etc. 8. Mrs. Félix sells mole, green salsa, and ground meat tamales. She will use the loan to buy materials such as: oil, tamale dough, poultry, meat, carrots, chiles, etc. 9. Mrs. Beatriz sell snacks so she will use the loan to buy products such as: cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, oil, chiles, etc.

loans.use: buy sodas, juices, soap, oil, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fanm Kapab 1 Group

texts.fr:
Guerline  est la coordinatrice de son groupe FANM KAPAB

 Elle n’est pas mariée mais Elle a un enfant.

Guerline habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti. Elle a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des lampes a batteries. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Guerline dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant .

Des autres membres de FANM KAPAB ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Elle dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est la construction d’une belle maison.
texts.en:
Guerline is the coordinator of "Fanm Kapab 1" Group. She is not married, but has a child. She lives in Trou-du-Nord in Haiti.

Guerline has run her business for the past seven years. She would like to use her loan to buy battery powered lamps. She hopes that the loan will enable her to expand her business. She says that her biggest challenge is the lack of loyal customers.

The other members of the group need their share of the loan for their businesses, such as coal, rice or fish stores.

Guerline says that her main objective is to expand her business. She dreams of building a beautiful house.

loans.use: to buy battery powered lamps.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for women, men, girls, and boys.

loans.name: El Bocote Group

texts.es:
La señora Elvira  cuenta con 56 años de edad  es casada y tiene 4 hijos los dos menores dependen de ella, ellos estudian la secundaria y bachillerato, su esposo se llama Epifanio y se dedica al campo. 

Ella se dedica al comercio tiene un pequeño negocio de frutas y legumbres el cual lo ha logrado mantener con la ayuda del préstamo ya que nos cuenta que le ha traído buenos beneficios en lo comercial y personal, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de frutas como son: manzana, plátano, uvas, ciruelas, etc.

Ella pertenece al grupo llamado el bocote ellas le pusieron ese nombre porque en el lugar donde hacen la reunión esta un árbol llamado bocote, el grupo esta integrado por  12 miembros lo cual serán mencionados.

El Sr. Lidio se dedica a vender pollos descuartizados y en pluma, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas pollos.

La Sra. Josefina se dedica a la venta de dulces, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de más dulces ya que salieron unos dulces nuevos.

La Sra. Fulgencia se dedica en la venta de comida, invirtió su préstamo en la compra de insumos que utiliza para elaborar la comida como son: aceite, verduras, carnes, etc.

La Sra. Leticia se dedica al comercio, ella vendes dulces afuera de su casa, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de chicharres, sabritas, jugos, dulces.

El Sr. José se dedica al comercio de verduras el vende todo tipo de verduras, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de frutas y verduras como son: manzana, jitomate, chile, cebolla, plátano, etc.

La Sra. Arcadia se dedica al comercio de verduras lo cual invirtió su préstamo en más verduras.

La Sra. Karina comercio de verduras el vende todo tipo de verduras, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de verduras como son: jitomate, chile, papa, zanahoria, etc.

El Sr. Margarito se dedica al comercio de maíz el compra el maíz y lo revende, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas maíz de temporada.

La Sra. Rosa se dedica al comercio de accesorios de mercería, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de más accesorios.

El Sr. Gieovani se dedica al comercio de pan el vende pan, invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar el pan como son: aceite, harina, azúcar, etc.

La Sra. Oralia se dedica al comercio de tamales, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar los tamales como son: pollo, chile, jitomate, etc.
texts.en:
Señora Elvira is 56 years old, She is married and has 4 children, two of which of minors and dependent on her. They attend middle and high school. Her husband is called Epifanio and he works in the fields.

She has a small business selling fruit and vegetables which she has managed to maintain with the help of the loan. She tells us that it has brought her great benefits both personally and commercially. She invested her loan in the purchase of fruit such as: apples, bananas, grapes, plums, etc.

She belongs to the group called the Bocote. They named it this because there is a bocote tree at the place where they meet. The group consists of 12 members who are listed below:
Señor Lidio works selling live and quartered chickens. He invested his loan in the purchase of more chickens.
Señora Josefina sells sweets. She invested her loan in the purchase of more candy and new kinds of sweets.
Señora Fulgencia sells cooked food. She invested her loan in the purchase of the consumables she uses to make the food such as: oil, vegetables, meat, etc. 
Señora Leticia has a business selling sweets outside her house. She invested her loan in the purchase of peas, potato chips, juices and sweets.
Señor José works selling vegetables. He sells all kinds of vegetables. He invested his loan in the purchase of fruit and vegetables such as: apples, tomatoes, chillis, onions, bananas, etc.
Señora Arcadia is in the vegetable business. She invested her loan in the purchase of more vegetables.
Señora Karina works selling vegetables. She sells all kinds of vegetables. She invested her loan in the purchase of vegetables such as: tomatoes, chillis, potatoes, carrots, etc.
Señor Margarito is in the corn business. He buys corn and resells it. He invested his loan in the purchase of more corn this season.
Señora Rosa works in the business of haberdashery accessories. She invested her loan in the purchase of more accessories.
Señor Gieovani works in the bread business. He sells bread. He invested his loan in the purchase of consumables used to make the bread such as: oil, flour, sugar, etc.
Señora Oralia works making tamales. She invested her loan in the purchase of consumables used to make the tamales such as: chicken, chillis, tomatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, bananas, grapes, plums etc.

loans.name: Huamuchapa Group

texts.es:
L. Sra. Esperanza cuenta con 69 años D. edad vive en unión libre con su esposo ya hace mucho tiempo él se llama Reyes tiene 75 años D. edad. ElL. y su esposo se dedican al comercio tiene una tienda D. abarrotes su préstamo lo invirtió en surtir su negocio en comprar más productos como son: refrescos, leche, huevo, arroz, azúcar, verduras, etc.

L. Sra. Esperanza dice que el préstamo le ha traído beneficios ya que las ganancias D. su negocio le sirven para surtir y para comer con su familia, a elL. le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco más 

ElL. pertenece al grupo huamuchapa el cual está integrado por 10 personas dos hombres y 8 mujeres las cuales a continuación son mencionadas:

L. Sra. María Guadalupe se dedica al comercio venD. frutas y verduras, elL. invirtió su préstamo en L. compra D. frutas como son: plátano, manzana, uvas, guayabas, mango, sandia, etc.

L. Sra. Virginia se dedica al comercio venD. frutas y verduras lo cual invirtió su crédito en L. compra D. frutas y verduras como son: manzana, lechuga, jitomate, chile, etc.

L. Sra. Silvia se dedica al comercio venD. cosmético por catalogo, elL. invirtió su préstamo en L. compra D. mas cosméticos y cremas y perfumes.

L. Sra. Celia se dedica al comercio venD. productos D. campo como son: frijol, sandia, melón, maíz, lo cual invirtió su préstamo en L. compra D. liquido y fertilizante.

El Sr. Abel se dedica al comercio venD. frutas y verduras, invirtió su préstamo en L. compra D. frutas como son: manzana, sandia, mango, plátano, peras, uvas, etc.

L. Sra. Llanet se dedica al comercio D. frutas y verduras lo cual  su préstamo en L. compra D. verdura como son: jitomate, cebolL., chile, aguacate, etc.

L. Sra. FideL. se dedica al comercio frutas y verduras lo cual invirtió su préstamo en L. compra D.: manzana, chile, aguacate, peras, plátanos, etc.

L. Sra. Reina se dedica al comercio D. pollos descuartizados, elL. invirtió su préstamo en L. compra D. pollos.

El Sr. Edilberto se dedica al comercio venD. frijol, maíz y semillas D. calabaza, lo cual invirtió su préstamo en L. compra D. líquido para cultivar como son: líquido y fertilizante.
texts.en:
Señora Esperanza is 69 years old.  She has been in a common-law marriage for many years; her husband's name is Reyes, and he is 75 years old.  Señora Esperanza and her husband both work in retail; they have a grocery store.  She invested her loan in stocking up her business by buying more products such as sodas, milk, eggs, rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.

Señora Esperanza says that the loan has been beneficial for her, as the earnings from her business have allowed her to both restock, and to feed her family.  She would like it if her business will grow a little more.

She belongs to the "Huamuchapa" group, which is maD. up of ten people (two men and eight women), who are mentioned below:

Señora María Guadalupe works in retail selling fruits and vegetables.  She invested her loan in purchasing fruit such as plantains, apples, grapes, guavas, mangoes, watermelons, etc.

Señora Virginia works in retail selling fruits and vegetables.  She invested her loan in purchasing fruits and vegetables such as apples, lettuce, tomatoes, chili peppers, etc.

Señora Silvia works in retail selling cosmetics from a catalog.  She invested her loan in purchasing more cosmetics, creams, and perfumes.

Señora Celia works in retail selling agricultural products such as beans, watermelon, melon and corn.  She invested her loan in purchasing liquid feritlizer.

Señor Abel works in retail selling fruits and vegetables.  He invested his loan in purchasing fruit such as apples, watermelons, mangoes, plantains, pears, grapes, etc.

Señora Llanet works retailing fruits and vegetables. She invested her loan in purchasing vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, avocados, etc.

Señora FideL. works retailing fruits and vegetables.  She invested her loan in purchasing apples, chili peppers, avocados, pears, plantains, etc.

Señora Reina works retailing quartered chickens.  She invested her loan in purchasing chickens.

Señor Edilberto works selling agricultural products such as beans, corn and pumpkin seeds. He invested his loan in purchasing liquids for cultivating crops, such as liquid fertilizer.

loans.use: to invest in stocking up her business by buying more products, such as sodas, milk, eggs, rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Las Malinches Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Malinches está conformado por las señoras Adelaida y Raquel van a comprar con su préstamo azúcar, huevo, refrescos, galletas, queso, aceite, jabón, arroz y frijol, la señora Genoveva va a comprar aguacate por caja, la señora Anastacia va a comprar aguacate, durazno, nuez por caja, la señora Consuelo va a comprar alimentos para engordar sus cerdos, la señora María Ricarda va a comprar verduras, aceite, queso, crema, plásticos, carne para preparar tacos y tostadas. La señora María Ricarda  tiene 50 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 4 hijos 3 hombres y 1 mujer todos son casados y ya trabajan, ella estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria, ella vende comida, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar verduras, carnes, gas, aceite, sal, queso, crema y maíz, ella inicio su negocio hace 22 años vendía comida en la escuela, los utensilios para preparar la comida, el refrigerador y la licuadora los compro en abonos, su negocio está en su casa, ella ofrece a sus clientes tamales, atole, tlacoyos, tacos dorados, tacos de arroz, pozole, enchiladas y guisados, su negocio es importante porque tiene su propio negocio y gana dinero para ayudar en los gastos de la familia, también su negocio le ayuda cuando hay necesidades de ahí tiene para darles a sus hijos, a ella le gusta preparar la comida servirle amable y sonriente a sus clientes, ella se siente orgullosa cuando los clientes regresan por mas comida porque le comentan que esta sabrosa, su negocio es muy conocido por los tamales y los tacos dorados los clientes llegan a hacer sus pedidos de tamales y tacos dorados, cuando son pedidos grandes contrata a 2 o 3 señoras que le ayudan a preparar los tamales, ella utiliza las ganancia para invertirlo nuevamente en los insumos para seguir en las ventas de comida, ella está planeando ponerle techo a su patio comprar sillas y mesas para que se vea más bonito su negocio y lo piensa lograr trabajando, echándole ganas y con los prestamos, sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir en su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos. Las integrantes del grupo les dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por sus préstamos y que sigan ayudando a la gente que lo necesita para seguir adelante en sus negocios.
texts.en:
This closely-knit group is called "Las Malinches" and is made up of Ms. Adelaida and Ms. Raquel who are going to use their loan to purchase sugar, eggs, drinks, cookies, cheese, oil, soap, rice and beans; Ms. Genoveva who will buy avocados by the box; Ms. Anastacia who will buy avocados, peaches and walnuts by the box; Ms. Consuelo who will buy feed for fattening her pigs; and Ms. María Ricarda who will buy vegetables, oil, cheese, cream, plastic items, and meat for preparing tacos and tostadas. 

Ms. María Ricarda is 50 years old and married with four children: three men and one woman, all of whom are married and now working. She studied through the sixth grade of elementary school. She sells prepared food and requested her loan for the purchase of vegetables, meats, natural gas, oil, salt, cheese, cream and corn. She began her business 22 years ago selling food at the school. She purchased the utensils for preparing the food, the refrigerator and the blender by installments. Her business is located in her home. She offers her customers tamales, atole, tlacoyos, fried tacos, rice tacos, pozole, enchiladas and stews. 

Her business is important because she has her own business and earns money to help with the family's expenses. Her business also allows her to share with her children when there is a need. She likes to prepare the food and, with a kind and friendly smile, serve her customers. She feels proud when the customers return for more food because they comment that it is delicious. Her business is well-known for the tamales and the fried tacos. The customers come and put in their orders for tamales and golden tacos. When there are large orders she hires two or three women who help her prepare the tamales. She uses the earnings to invest once again in the supplies for continuing to sell prepared food. She is planning to put a roof over her patio and buy chairs and tables so her business will look nicer. She plans to achieve her goal by working with enthusiasm and through the loans. Her dreams and hopes are to continue on in business and help her children. 

The members of the group thank Kiva and the Fundación Realidad for their loans, and hope they will continue to help the people who need it so they can get ahead in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, natural gas, oil, salt, cheese, cream and corn.

loans.name: Las Hongueras Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Hongueras, está conformado por la señora Rosario va a comprar con su crédito fertilizantes y abono para cultivar hongos, la señora Janet va a comprar blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, la señora Sandra Luz va a comprar palas, clavos, tornillos, carretillas, la señora Erika va a comprar pollo por mayoreo para vender por kilo o entero. La señora Rosario tiene 59 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 5 hijos ya casados, ella produce hongos setas, ella solicito su préstamo para su proyecto de hongos setas para aumentar su producción, ella va a comprar semilla y abono para su producción de hongos y aumentar su negocio. Ella inicio su negocio hace 18 años, su hijo que es ingeniero la asesora como producir el hongos setas, su negocio es importante porque tiene su propio trabajo donde su familia participa en la produccion de los hongos setas sus hijos y su esposo los producen y a ella como le gustan las ventas participa en la mercadotecnea buscando mercado donde colocar su producción de hongos en los puestos de verduras de plazas, mercados, tianguis, en los puestos de dobladas. Las ganancias las utiliza para la comida, usos personal y para seguir invirtiendo, sus sueños y esperanzas son que su producción sea grande y poner una procesadora de hongos enlatados, que no les falte el trabajo y poder sustentar los gastos que se requieran para el negocio. Las integrantes del grupo les agradecen a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad sus préstamos que son muy buenos y les ayudan a crecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is Las Hongueras.  The group is comprised of:

Rosario will use the loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers to cultivate mushrooms.

Janet will buy blouses, shirts, and skirts.

Sandra Luz will buy shovels, nails, screws, and wheelbarrows.

Erika will buy chicken wholesale in order to sell whole or by the kilo.

Rosario, age 59, is married and has five children who are already married.  She produces mushrooms.  She is requesting her loan for her mushroom business in order to increase her production.  She will buy seeds and fertilizer for her mushroom production and increase her business.

She started her business 18 years ago.  Her son, an engineer, advises her about how to produce mushrooms.  Her business is important because she has her own work where her family participates in the mushroom production.  Her children and her husband cultivate them.

She likes the sales and marketing.  She looks for the market where she can place her mushrooms in the vegetable stands in plazas, markets, street markets, and take out stands.  She uses the income for food, personal use, and to continue investing.  Her hopes and dreams are that her production expands, that she sets up a canned mushroom processor, that she does not lack work, and that she is able to cover the expenses that are needed for her business.

The members of the group are grateful to Kiva and the Fundación Realidad.  Their loans are very good, and they help their businesses grow.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for mushroom production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials so that she can expand her stationery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables such as chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
Simeona nació en la provincia de La Convención en la ciudad de Quillabamba por la selva del Perú. Actualmente, Simeona tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo. 

Simeona radica desde hace 19 años en la ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es ama de casa y vive de la pensión de su esposo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la colegiatura de su hijo Wilfredo que es profesional en economía. 

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Simeona was born in the city of Quillabamba in La Convención Province, which is in the Peruvian jungle. She is 62 years old, widowed, and has one child.

Simeona moved to the city of Calca at the age of 19 and this is where she conducts all of her financial activities. She is a homemaker and lives off of her husband’s pension. Simeona is taking this opportunity to request a loan to pay for her son Wilfredo’s tuition since he is studying for a professional degree in economics.

The Communal Bank “Milenium III” meets every 30 days in the city of Calca in the Department of Cusco in Peru. Cusco is recognized for being an area for tourism and business. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition.

loans.name: Nuevo Esfuerzo 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yennifer is the coordinator of her group 'Nuevo Esfuerzo' 1 & 3 (New Effort). She is excited to be taking her third loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has been in this business for six years, and for the last year has been running a cosmetics products sales business by catalog. She started this by buying products on credit. 
Yennifer is a young woman, still single and without children. She is dedicated to working in her business to support herself and to help her parents. She says that her biggest challenge is to finish studying in the university – she started years ago but needed to stop. Now she is planning to make better profits after investing this loan to buy different products and expand her customer base. She is selling a well-known brand of cosmetic products, which sell through catalogs. Her customers order what they need and Yennifer buys different products to have as her own inventory. 
Yennifer dreams of having her own house and a big and sustainable business so she could have everything she wants. She is grateful to have her family too. All the members in this group are taking loans to improve their businesses and lives. The group members are located in the urban slums surrounding Samana.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica nació en la provincia de La Convención en la ciudad de Quillabamba por la selva del Perú. Actualmente, Veronica tiene 35 años de edad y tiene un hijo (Luis de 14 años de edad). 

Veronica radica desde hace 20 años en la ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella es docente y trabaja en uno de los colegios particulares de la ciudad de Calca, ella en sus horas libres se dedica  a  la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catalogo, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza. Su sueño de Veronica es abrir un centro educativo inicial.  

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Veronica was born in the city of Quillabamba in La Convención Province, which is in the Peruvian jungle. She is 35 years old and has a 14-year-old son named Luis.

Veronica moved to the city of Calca at the age of 20 and this is where she conducts all of her business activities. She works at one of the private schools in the city of Calca. During her free time, Veronica sells beauty products through catalogs. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more beauty products. Her dream is to open a preschool.

The Communal Bank “Milenium III” meets every 30 days in the city of Calca in the Department of Cusco in Peru. Cusco is recognized for being an area for tourism and business. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota nació en la provincia de Calca en el departamento del Cusco como quien se dirige al Valle SagR. de los Incas. Actualmente, Carlota tiene 57 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 29 años de edad pero que ya es independiente. 

Carlota vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y también se dedica a la crianza de animales como aves de corral, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más aves de corral y para implementar la tienda de abarrotes y desea comprar bolsas de azúcar y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Carlota was born in the province of Calca, department of Cusco, located along the way to the Sacred Valley of the Incas. She is currently 57 years old and has a 29-year-old son who's already independent.
Carlota lives and works in the same town where she was born. She has a small grocery store in her home and she also raises animals such as corral poultry. On this occasion, she requests the loan in order to purchase more corral birds and to stock her grocery store - she wishes to buy bags of sugar, among other things.
Communal bank "Millenium III" gathers together every thirty days in the town of Calca, deparment of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristic and commercial area. It is also known because of its traditional feast of Inti Raymi and because of one of the seven wonders of the world - Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase more corral poultry and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth nació en la provincia del Cusco por el sur del Perú y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Ruth radica desde hace 15 años en la ciudad de calca y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a alquilar dormitorios de su casa. 

Ruth y su hijo Yiukyo piensan abrir un restaurante para ofrecer comidas típicas de la región y por lo tanto ella requiere el préstamo para implementar el local y desea comprar platos, cubiertos y otras más.  

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Ruth was born in the province of Cusco in the south of Peru. She has four children. For the last fifteen years she has lived in the town of Calca where she earns her living renting out rooms in her house.

Ruth and her son Yiukyo are planning to open a restaurant serving traditional food. For this reason Ruth requires a loan to set up the restaurant; she wishes to buy dishes, cutlery, etc.

The Milenium III Comunity Bank meets every month in Calca in the department of Cusco, Peru. The town is known for its tourist areas, its commerce, and its traditional festival Inti Raymi. As well it is the home of one of the seven wonders of the world, Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy dishes, cutlery etc.

loans.name: Luis Gerardo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 39 años es casado y tiene 3 hijas, vive con su familia en Pimampiro que está a 45 minutos de Ibarra. Luis se describe como una persona trabajadora que le gusta la agricultura.

Trabaja con su esposa y un trabajador en la siembra de fréjol, tomátes y legumbres es el cuarto crédito que le solicita a FODEMI el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de semillas de fréjol lo cual aumentará su productividad y mejorarán sus ingresos que es ,o mejor para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Su sueño es poder construir su casita y dar el estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
39-year old Luis is married and has three daughters. He and his family live in Pimampiro which is 45 minutes from Ibarra. Luis describes himself as a hardworking person who enjoys working on his farm.

Along with his wife and a worker, he grows beans, tomatoes, and vegetables. This is his fourth loan with FODEMI which he will use to buy bean seeds for planting. His fields will produce more and he will increase his income so he and his family can have a better quality of life.

His dream is build a house of his own and provide an education for his daughters.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma was born in the Sacred Valley of the Incas in the town of Calca. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children.

She still lives and works in the town where she was born. She sells shoes from a catalog of a well-known company, work she has been doing for the last eight years. It is going very well. As well, she sells beauty products.

Vilma needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as shoes. Her dream is to buy a car so she can use it as a taxi within the urban area where she lives.

She is a member of the Milenium III Community Bank which meets every month in Calca in the department of Cusco, Peru. The town is known for its tourist areas, its commerce, and its traditional festival Inti Raymi. As well it is the home of one of the seven wonders of the world, Machupicchu.
texts.en:
Vilma nació en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca y tiene 47 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. 

Vilma vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por medio un catalogo de una empresa reconocida, ella desde hace 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, ella también se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como zapatos. Su sueño de Vilma es comprarse un carro para que pueda ser utilizado para brindar de servicio de transporte urbano. 

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes

loans.name: Carlos Daniel

texts.es:
Carlos Daniel nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 51 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.  

Carlos Daniel vive en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, él se dedica a la elaboración de café procesado y chocolate, él viaja a la ciudad de Quillabamba a la selva del Cusco y compra materia prima que son el café y el cacao para elaborar sus productos. Ya son 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Carlos Daniel requiere el préstamo para comprar más materia prima como es el café y el cacao. Su sueño de Carlos Daniel es implementar su empresa de nuevas tecnologías para poder sacar diferentes productos en base a cacao y café. 

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Carlos Daniel was born in the city of Cusco.  He is 51, married and has two children.

Carlos Daniel lives in Valle Sagrado de los Incas in the city of Calca where he has a business processing coffee and chocolate.  He travels to the city of Quillabamba in the Cusco forest and buys raw materials such as coffee and cocoa to make his products.  He has been in business for five years and it is doing very well.

On this occasion Carlos Daniel needs a loan to buy more raw materials.  His dream is to set up a business with new technology so he can produce different cocoa and coffee products.

The communal bank "Milenium III" meets every month in the city of Calca, in the department of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, trade and the Inti Raymi traditional festivities.  It is also home to one of the Seven Wonders of the World, "Machupicchu".

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as coffee and cocoa.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: La señora Genoveva y su familia viven en la zona D. Kupini que ubicada a veinticinco minutos del centro D. la ciudad D. La Paz. Ella y su familia tienen un pequeño taller D. elaboración D. calzados D. cholitas y trabajan D. esta manera desD. hace veinte años atrás. Los calzados D. cholitas son elaborados D. manera muy tradicional y es por eso también que tienen varios clientes en diferentes ferias D. esta ciudad y la ciudad del Alto. Los calzados D. cholitas son hechos con diferentes materiales pero actualmente los mas utilizados son el plástico transparente y cuerinas además D. suelas y plantas D. goma. Y son muy parecidos a zapatillas pero son utilizados principalmente por cholitas y señoras D. pollera quienes saben apreciar un trabaja tradicional y bien realizado como son los calzados del taller D. doña Genoveva. En esta oportunidad la señora Genoveva solicita el préstamo D. dinero para el mantenimiento en general D. un automóvil que tiene y lo hace trabajar en el servicio D. radio taxi.
texts.en: Mrs. Genoveva and her family live in the Kupini area which is about 25 minutes from downtown La Paz.  Her family has a small shop where they make "cholitas" , having been in business for 20 years.  This type of footwear is maD. in a very traditional style and that's why they have several customers at the different fairs around the city and in the city of Alto.  The cholitas are maD. from different materials but the ones used nowadays are maD. of transparent plastic and synthetic leather, with rubber soles and heels.  They are very similar to slippers but worn mainly by the cholitas (wearing typical dress) who know how to appreciate traditional and well-maD. crafts such as the shoes from Mrs. Genoveva's shop.  She is requesting a loan on this occasion for general maintenance of her automobile which she uses to proviD. a radio taxi service.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector nació en la ciudad de Arequipa al sur de Perú, tiene 51 años de edad y tiene dos hijos.  

Hector vive en la ciudad del Cusco y con mucha frecuencia viene a la ciudad de Calca, él es un microempresario que se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía, él desde hace 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo plástico liquido, marmolina, pinturas, disolventes y también herramientas como esmerile, tallador, lijas y fajas. 

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Hector was born in the city of Arequipa in the south of Peru. He is 51 years old and has 2 children.

Hector lives in the city of Cusco and oftens comes to the town of Calca. He is a small businessman who works in crafts. He has been doing this for the last 10 years and is doing very well. This time, he is asking for a loan to buy marterials such as liquid plastic, marble, paints, solvents and also tools such as a grinder, cutter, sandpaper and belts.

The communal bank “Milenium III” meets every thirty days in the city of Calca in the department of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known as a popular tourist destination and commercial centre and for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi. It is also located close to one of the seven wonders of the world “Machupicchu”.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Benigna Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda nació en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Pisaq, tiene 30 años de edad y tiene un hijo (Nil de 10 años de edad). Yolanda vive en la ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de maíz blanco, haba seca, quinua y trigo, ella desde muy joven se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz. Su sueño de Yolanda es abrir una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos.  

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Yolanda was born in the Valle Sagrado de los Incas in the city of Pisaq. She is 30 years old and has a son (Nil who is 10 years old). Yolanda lives in the city of Calca which is where she works. She sells white corn, dry beans, quinoa and wheat. She has been doing this work since she was very young and is doing very well. This time, she is asking for a loan to buy corn, Yolanda's dream is to open a shop where she can sell her products.

The communal bank “Milenium III” meets every thirty days in the city of Calca in the department of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known as a tourist destination and commercial centre and for its festival Inti Raymi. It is also close to one of the seven wonders of the world “Machupicchu”.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Lourdes Edith

texts.es:
Lourdes nació en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca, tiene 56 años de edad y tiene una hija (Jubitza de 17 años de edad). Lourdes vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella es profesora un prestigio instituto de la ciudad del Cusco y ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos mediante catalogo y la preparación de mermeladas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como azúcar, frutas y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Lourdes es abrir un hospedaje turístico.  

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Lourdes was born in the Sacred Valley of the Incas in the city of Calca.  She is 56 years old, and she has a 17 year old daughter, Jubitza.  Lourdes lives in the city of Cusco, where she does different business activities.

She is a teacher at a prestigious school in the city of Cusco.  In her free time she sells cosmetics by catalog, and she makes jams.

At this time she needs a loan to buy supplies like sugar, fruit, and other things.  Lourdes’ dream is to open a business lodging tourists.

The Milenium III Communal Bank meets once a month in the city of Calca in the Cusco (Peru) department.  Cusco  is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sugar, fruit, and other things.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Enercida is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress) 1 & 2. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She decided to take a loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza International, because she joined a group with very good friends and all of them are hard workers, dedicated to their businesses.

Enercida is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling a well-known brand of cosmetic products through catalogs and also selling second-hand clothing. She will purchase a bag of such clothes and different cosmetic products to be show in a product display stall, which she also will buy with this loan. Enercida is planning to save part of her business profits to get a site for her business, because she wants to improve her business.

Enercida dreams of having her own house and of seeing all her children go to school and become professionals. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a product display stall and a bag of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia nació en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca, tiene 37 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. Virginia vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado de la ciudad de Calca. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

En esta oportunidad Virginia requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como polos, pantalones, blusas, camisas y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Virginia es abrir una tienda pero que este bien implementada de ropa.   

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Virginia was born in the Sacred Valley of the Incas in the city of Calca.  She is 37 years old, and she has two children.  Virginia lives in the city where she was born, where she engages in different business activities.

She has a small stand where she sells clothes at the market in the city of Calca.  She has had the business for one year, and it is going very well for her.

At this time Virginia needs a loan to buy more merchandise like polo style shirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other items.  Virginia’s dream is to open a store, one that is well stocked with clothes.

The Milenium III Communal Bank meets once a month in the city of Calca in the Cusco (Peru) department.  Cusco  is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like polo style shirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Nohelia

texts.es:
Nohelia nació en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca, tiene 25 años de edad y tiene cinco hijos. Nohelia vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella es profesora y trabaja en un prestigioso colegio de la ciudad de Calca, ella enseña al nivel secundario y tiene ejerciendo su profesión tres años y le va muy bien. 

Nohelia y su mamá tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida a pedido del cliente, Nohelia pone el capital y su mama pone la mamo de obra y al momento de repartir ganancias lo hacen equitativamente.  

En esta oportunidad Nohelia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo papa, carne y otras cosas más. Su sueño de Nohelia es viaja al extranjero y comprarse un departamento en la ciudad del Cusco.

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Nohelia was born in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, in the city of Calca.  She is 25 years old and has five children.  Nohelia lives in the same city where she was born, and this is where she undertakes her various economic activities.  She is a teacher at a prestigious high school in the city of Calca.  She teaches at secondary-school level, and has been in this position for three years; it is going very well for her.

Nohelia and her mom have a small business selling meals to order to her customers.  Nohelia puts in the capital while her mom puts in the work, and at the point when they distribute the earnings, they do so equally.

On this occasion Nohelia is requesting the loan to purchase more ingredients such as potatoes, meat and other things.  Nohelia's dreams are to travel overseas and to buy a place for herself in the city of Cusco.

The "Milenium III" Communal Bank meets monthly in the city of Calca, in the Department of Cusco (in Peru).  Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and also because it's where you find Machu Pichu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients.

loans.name: Lalo Vitorino

texts.es:
Vitorino nació en la selva del Perú exactamente en la provincia de La Convención en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tiene 49 años de edad y tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Vitorino vive en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, él es carpintero y fabrica todo tipo de muebles de madera como por ejemplo puertas, carpetas, roperos, mesas, sillas, camas y muchas otras cosas más. 

En esta oportunidad Vitorino requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo madera, clavos, cola de carpintero y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Milenium III” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Vitorino was born in the Peruvian rainforest, in La Convención province, in the town of Quillabamba.  He is 49 years old and has three children.

Vitorino currently lives in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, in the city of Calca and this is where he carries out his business activities.  Vitorino is a carpenter.  He makes all kinds of wooden furniture such as doors, desks, wardrobes, tables, chairs, beds and many other items.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy materials such as wood, nails, wood glue, etc.  

The 'Milenium III' community bank meets once a month in the city of Calca, in Cusco department (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, nails, wood glue, etc.

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es:
Ana de 46 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que vende ropa desde muy temprano en la mañana. Desde que su esposo la abandono y se quedo con su hija pequeña ella decidió emprender su propio negocio para poder generar sus propios ingresos. 

En la actualidad vende pantalones, blusas, toallas a un valor muy económico para sus clientes. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con un préstamo para comprar pantalones, camisas, etc.  En el futuro quiere incrementar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old. She is a hardworking worman who sells clothes very early in the morning. Since being abandoned by her husband and left alone with a young daughter, she decided to start her own business to generate her own income.

Currently she sells trousers, blouses, towels all at very reasonable prices for her clients. She has many aspirations for her business which is why she wants to continue with a loan to buy trousers, shirts, etc. In the future, she wants to increase sales of her business.

loans.use: to buy trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Robertina is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress) 3 & 4, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).
Robertina’s group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsuL., an area with a nascent tourism industry. Robertina makes her home here in a simple structure with her only child. Her group is composed of ten business people, dedicated to different businesses such as selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics and running grocery stores, beauty salons, etc. 
Robertina runs a small cafeteria, which sells all kind of snacks. She is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She started to do business five years ago, when she took her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying sweets, snack, juices, etc. 
Robertina will use the profits to invest in new items and increase her inventory. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy sweets, snacks, juices, etc.

loans.name: Ligia Monabel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ligia, tiene 31 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y quedo sola con sus tres hijos de 14, 12 y 9 años de edad, los mayores está estudiando en colegio y el menor en escuela. Ella vive sola con sus hijos.

Ella después de que su esposo falleció tuvo que dedicarse a realizar el trabajo sola ya que antes trabajaban juntos,  ella se dedica a la venta de pescado,  tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad Portoviejo en el cual vende todo tipo de pescado ya sea pescados pequeños o por libras. Trabaja de jueves a domingo desde las 5h00 hasta las 18h00, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio despues de cumplir con sus estudios, nos cuenta que lleva 9 años dedicada a esta actividad, el pescado lo compran a comerciantes en el mismo mercado. 

Este crédito es para invertirlo en comprar pescado para surtir su negocio. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es socia fundadora y le gusta por la  responsabilidad del grupo.

Su sueño es que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Virgen de Guadalupe' community bank meet in Andrés De Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as 'the city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Here we meet 31-year-old Ligia.  Several years ago Ligia's beloved husband died and left her alone with her three children aged 14, 12 and 9.  The older children are in high school and her youngest is in elementary school.  She lives alone with her children.

After her husband died, Ligia had to start working alone as she used to work together with her husband.  Her business is selling fish.  She has a stall in the market in the city of Portoviejo where she sells all kinds of fish, both small fish and fish by the pound.  She works from Thursday to Sunday, from 5.00am to 6.00pm.  Her children help her in the business when they finish school.  She tells us that she has been in this business for nine years.  She buys her fish from salespeople in the market.

Ligia will use this loan to invest in buying fish with which to stock her business.  This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank.  She is a founding member of the bank and she likes it because of the responsibility shown by the group.

Ligia's dream is for her children to never want for anything.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 60 años es divorciado vive en Pimampiro que se encuentra a 45 minutos de Ibarra en el norte de Ecuador. José se describe como una persona trabajadora que cada día  quiere superarse.

José trabaja como albañil desde que tenía 18 años, a veces trabaja por obras solo, y cuando son obras grandes trabaja con unos compañeros. Trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2006, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de materiales de construcción que lo va a utilizar en la construcción de su casa.

Su sueño es poder acabar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
José is 60 years old and divorced.  He lives in Pimampiro which is located 45 minutes from Ibarra, in the north of Ecuador.  José describes himself as a hard-working person who always wants to improve himself.

José has been working as a builder since he was 18 years old.  He sometimes works on jobs by himself but when the jobs are big ones he works together with some friends.  He has been working with Fodemi since 2006.  José is currently requesting a loan to buy building supplies which he will use in building his house.

José's dream is to be able to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy building supplies such as cement, gravel, blocks and bricks

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 37 años, es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Raúl de 38 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Frank de 12 años y Fiorella de 09 años de edad, quienes son  el impulso  de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar Virginia  y su pareja, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café, achiote y hojas de coca, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes le ayudan en las extracción y transporte de sus productos cosechados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes. Lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco lugar donde los vende y recibe buenos pagos por sus productos. Para el futuro desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este será su segundo crédito y se siente muy contenta de saber que contará una vez mas con el apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que así se sentirá segura de seguir prosperando y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de cacao, con lo cual espera aumentar sus futuras cosechas.
texts.en:
37-year-old Virginia is originally from the town of Santa Rosa.  She is a sociable and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 38-year-old Raúl, and her two beloved children: 12-year-old Frank and 9-year-old Fiorella, who are the motivation behind all her hard work.

The produce which Virginia and her partner have managed to grow through their hard work and determination have helped them a lot in making progress in life.  Every morning, Virginia starts working on her land as she knows that the quality of her produce depends on the care she provides to her cacao, coffee, annatto and coca leaf crops.  During harvest seasons she needs the support of laborers who help her to pick and transport her harvested crops.  What she most enjoys about her work is caring for her crops and she feels very happy when she sees them grow big.  She has been in this business for five years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her harvested crops to the storage warehouses in the town of San Francisco where she sells them and receives a good price for them.  In the future, she would like to buy more land.

This will be Virginia's second loan and she feels very happy to know that she will once more have your support as this makes her certain that she will continue to do well in her business.  For her part, she is prepared to make her repayments punctually, according to the repayment schedule.  Virginia will use the 2,500 soles she has requested to buy more cacao seeds with which she hopes to increase her future harvests.

loans.use: to buy more cacao seeds

loans.name: Jessenia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen de Guadalupe.

En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 10, 7 y 2  años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en una ferretería.
 
Es una ama de casa muy luchadora y trabadora que para ganarse algo propio y contribuir con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella vende de ropa de todo tipo y joyería de plata, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta. También trabaja en un  almacén de venta de ropa en el centro de la ciudad por lo que recibe un sueldo mensual, nos cuenta que  ella aprovecha sus momentos libres y por las noches para realizar sus ventas. Trabaja todos los días desde las  8h00  hasta las 18h00 en su trabajo y más tarde en sus propias ventas, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 4 años se dedica a su negocio y  10 años a su empleo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece el banco.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio almacén de ropa.

En la fotografía está nuestra socia con su hija.
texts.en:
The members of the "Virgen de Guadalupe" Communal Bank meet every two week in the Andrés De Vera parish, in the city of Portoviejo which is the capital of Manabí.   Portoviejo has been well-known for a long time as "The CIty of the Royal Tamarinds".  

This is where Señora Jessenia lives.  She is 31 years old and lives in a common-law marriage, from which she has three children aged 10, 7 and 2.  The two eldest attend primary school.  Her husband works in a hardware store.

Jessenia manages the home, and works very hard and strives to earn something herself and contribute to the household expenses. She sells all kinds of clothes and silver jewelry, which she sells door to door.   She works in a clothes store in the city center, where she receives a monthly salary.  She tells us that she takes advantage of her free time and does her selling in the evenings.  She works every day from 8 a.m. through to 6 p.m. in her job, and then works later still with her own sales.  She provides credit to her customers, and collects payment every two weeks.  She has had her business for four years, and has been working in her job for the last ten years.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothes.  She has been in the Communal Bank since it began, and she likes the benefits that the bank offers.

Her dream is to have her own clothing store.

The photograph shows our member, with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Kelly Janneth

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Trabajando Para Un Futuro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños que son reconocidos en todo el país y por la calidez de su gente amable trabajadora.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Kelly, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 7 y 5 años de edad, el mayor vive con los abuelos en El Triunfo en la provincia del Guayas ciudad de la que es oriunda nuestra amiga y los dos menores viven con ella y estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer y también se dedica a la agricultura. Ella aprendió belleza en una academia en la ciudad de Azogues ciudad en la cual vivió por 3 años.
 
Ella es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora que comparte su tiempo entre su hogar y sus actividades diarias, ella realiza todo tipo de trabajos de belleza como: tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas y otros trabajos, nos cuenta que dia a dia llegan muchos clientes hasta su casa para realizarse trabajos de arreglo personal. Además también realiza el crédito para darle a su esposo el cual siembra arroz y verduras en el campo.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando tintes y permanentes y para el negocio de su esposo el cual va a comprar abonos y fertilizantes para tener una buena producción. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la tesorera del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la institución.
  
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser profesional para conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte the communal bank of Trabajando Para Un Futuro meets every 15 days. This place is well known for the delicious sweets made by the locals which are known throughout the country and for the warmth of its friendly, hardworking people.

Here we met Señora Kelly. She is 27 years old and is married. She has 3 children from the marriage aged 14, 7 and 5 years. The eldest lives with the grandparents in El Triunfo in the province of Guayas, a city our friend is a native of. The two minors live with her and study at school. Her husband is a driver and also works in agriculture. She studied at a beauty academy in the city of Azogues where she lived for 3 years.
 
She is a very active and hardworking woman who divides her time between her home and her daily activities. She gives all kinds of beauty treatments such as: hairdying, nailpainting, haircuts, and other such treatments. She tells us a lot of clients come to her house every day to have beauty treatments. In addition, she also makes money to give to her husband who sows rice and vegetables in the fields.

She is going to invest this loan in her business buying dyes and perms and in her husband's business to buy manure and fertilizers in order to have a good crop. She is a founding member of the communal bank, the treasurer for the group and she enjoys the support provided by the institution.

Her dreams are to complete her studies and become a professional in order to obtain a good job.

loans.use: to buy dyes, perms, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.es: Zocima, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 49 años,  es una mujer trabajadora vive en su propia casa al lado de sus 05 queridos hijos en la comunidad de Unión, anexo del distrito de Santa Rosa.
