Claudio requiere el micro crédito para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Claudio was born in the province of Paucartambo, in the city of Challabamba.  He is 46 years old and married, and has a son from this relationship.

Currently Claudio lives in the city of Huancarani, which is where he works.  He works in agriculture and livestock, and also works for the municipality of Huancarani in the Works department.

Claudio is requesting the micro-loan to buy small animals such as guinea-pigs and hens.

The "Once de Mayo - Huancarani" Communal Bank meets monthly in the district of Huancarani, which is in Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco (in Peru).  Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea-pigs and hens.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Huancarani y tiene 40 años de edad, ella es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Actualmente, Benita vive en la  misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria muy cerca  a la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani. Benita requiere el micro crédito para comprar insumos como bolsas de arroz, bolsas de azúcar, botella de aceite, verduras, carne y otras cosas más. 
 
El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Benita was born in the Paucartambo province in the city of Huancarani.  She is 40 years old, divorced, and has four children.  Benita currently lives in the same city where she was born.  She conducts her business activities there; she sells food in an itinerant manner.  She sells very close to the main plaza in the city of Huancarani.

Benita needs the small loan to buy ingredients like bags of rice, bags of sugar, bottles of oil, vegetables, meat, and other things.

The “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” (Eleventh of May - Huancarani) Communal Bank meets once a month in Huancarani district, Paucartambo province,  Cusco (Peru) department.  Cusco  is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bags of rice, bags of sugar, bottles of oil, vegetables, meat, and other things.

loans.name: 01 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hòe is 59 years old and she is married with three children and one dependent. She is the group leader of the 01 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Mrs Hòe works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise to sell. This is Hòe's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. With her business profits, Hòe hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Nueva Esperanza y tiene 54 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo.  

Actualmente, Josefina vive en la ciudad de Huancarani  y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, ella también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía como por ejemplo mantas, chompas, pantalones y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Josefina requiere el crédito para comprar lana. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Josefina was born in the Paucartambo province in the city of Nueva Esperanza.  She is 54 years old, married, and has one child.  Josefina currently lives in the city of Huancarani, where she conducts her business activities.  She raises small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She also hand makes things like blankets, sweaters, pants, and other things. 

Josefina now needs the loan to buy wool.

The “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” (Eleventh of May - Huancarani) Communal Bank meets once a month in Huancarani district, Paucartambo province, Cusco (Peru) department.  Cusco is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: 60 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. 
Lan is 47 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in T. Hoa City, a urban town in T. Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 60 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
Lan is requesting a loan to purchase machines to offer a tailoring and clothing repair service. This is Lan's first loan with T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to buy a new motorbike, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase machines to offer a tailoring and clothing repair service.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Quiñer y tiene 23 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo.  

Actualmente, Clotilde vive en la ciudad de Huancarani  y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo tejido y a la venta de comida en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani. En esta oportunidad Clotilde requiere el crédito para comprar lana y insumos como arroz, azúcar, carne y verduras. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Clotilde was born in Paucartambo province, in the city of Quiñer.  She is 23 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has one son.

Clotilde currently lives in the town of Huancarani and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Clotilde makes all kinds of handicrafts (knitting) and also sells food in the main square in the town of Huancarani.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy yarn and supplies such as rice, sugar, meat and vegetables.

The 'Once de Mayo - Huancarani' community bank meet once a month in Huancarani district, in Paucartambo, in Cusco department (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy yarn and supplies such as rice, sugar, meat and vegetables

loans.name: 2 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Huệ operates a food stall selling shrimp. She is requesting a loan to purchase shrimp to resell.

Huệ is 46 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 2 Điện Biên solidarity group. She lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to remodel her house. She wants her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp to resell.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es:
Tereza nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Quiñer y tiene 62 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Tereza vive en la ciudad de Huancarani  y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani los días domingos y tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Tereza requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como gaseosas. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Tereza was born in Paucartambo province, in the town of Quiñer.  She is 62 years old, widowed, and has three children.

Tereza currently lives in the town of Huancarani and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Tereza sells food in the main square in the town of Huancarani on Sundays.  She also has a grocery store where she sells basic household products such as rice, sugar, etc.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as soda.

The 'Once de Mayo - Huancarani' community bank meets once a month in Huancarani district, in Paucartambo province, in Cusco department (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and also because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soda

loans.name: 2 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Huyền works in agriculture with poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

She is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 2 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main hardship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, she hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Quiñer y tiene 28 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Felipa vive en la ciudad de Huancarani  y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos de lana de alpaca y de lana de llama. En esta oportunidad Felipa requiere el crédito para comprar lana. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Felipa was born in Paucartambo province, in the town of Quiñer.  She is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.

Felipa currently lives in the town of Huancarani and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Felipa knits products from alpaca yarn and llama yarn.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy yarn.

The 'Once de Mayo' community bank meets once a month in Huancarani district, in Paucartambo province, in Cusco department (Peru).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: 4 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Minh works in agriculture growing rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale. She is 33 years old and she is married with 1 child. Minh is the group leader of the 4 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives with her child in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes to remodel her house. She wants her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale.

loans.name: 12 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Lan operates a food stall selling rice noodle. She is requesting a loan to purchase material for her rice noodle stall. She is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 12 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. Lan lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2008, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and to buy more land. She wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material for her rice noodle stall.

loans.name: Leandra

texts.es:
Leandra nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Quiñer y tiene 67 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Actualmente, Leandra vive en la ciudad de Huancarani  y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas los días domingos y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos. En esta oportunidad Leandra requiere el crédito para comprar cuyes. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Leandra was born in Paucartambo Province in the city of Quiñer.  She’s 67 years old, married and has four children.  

Currently, Leandra lives in the city of Huancarani where she carries out her economic activities.  She sells snacks on Sundays and also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs and pigs.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy guinea pigs.

The “Once de Mayo-Huancarani” (May 11-Huancarani) communal bank meets monthly in Huancarani District of Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is widowed with two grown children. 

Esther is a teacher in a reputable school in which she is considered a regular employee. She owns a motorcycle which is run by a family member to earn additional income. She seldom uses the vehicle on important matters, and it is primarily for hire.  She has had the vehicle for 2 years and earns a total of about PHP 12,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase vehicle accessories to offer a better service.
 
She became part of GDMPC earlier this year. This is her third loan request in the cooperative. In the future, Esther hopes to fix her motorcycle to keep it going and add suitable accessories to make it more appealing to gain more income. She wants to possess an automobile soon.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle accessories to offer a better service.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Huata Grande y tiene 42  años de edad, ella es casada y tiene seis hijos. 

Actualmente, Juliana vive en la ciudad de Huancarani  y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos como por ejemplo ponchos, pantalones, chullos y mantas, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. En esta oportunidad Juliana requiere el crédito para comprar lana y algunos animales mas como cuyes. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Juliana was born in Paucartambo Province in the city of Huata Grande.  She’s 42 years old, married and has six children.  

Currently, Juliana lives in the city of Huancarani where she carries out her economic activities.  She manufactures woven items like ponchos, pants, ‘chullos’ [traditional Peruvian knit caps] and blankets.  She also raises small farm animals.  On this occasion, Juliana needs the loan to buy some wool and also some animals, like more guinea pigs.

The “Once de Mayo-Huancarani” (May 11-Huancarani) communal bank meets monthly in Huancarani District of Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy wool and some animals, like guinea pigs.

loans.name: Joe Ann

texts.en:
Joe Ann is married with seven school-aged children. Joe Ann is 42 years old and lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a general store selling grocery items, some hardware products, kitchenware, varieties of rice, school and office supplies and much more. She has run the business for over ten years and has met various personalities (gentle, stern, frank persons, etc.). Little by little she got used to it. Each month, she earns about PHP 18,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more rice for resale.

Joe Ann has been a member of GDMPC since 1995. She is a long time member of the cooperative. This current request is her 27th loan cycle recorded with GDMPC. In the future, Joe Ann hopes to widen her selling area and acquire new feasible products to sell to sustain the business. She wants all of her children to finish a degree.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for resale.

loans.name: Tadea

texts.es:
Tadea nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Huancarani y tiene 48 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene seis hijos. 

Actualmente, Tadea vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de sopas, comidas y caldos de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Huancarani. En esta oportunidad Tadea requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como carne, verduras, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Tadea was born in Paucartambo Province in the city of Huancarani.  She’s 48 years old, a widow and has six children.  

Currently, Tadea lives in the city of her birth where she carries out her economic activities.  She sells soup, meals and broth throughout the city of Huancarani.  On this occasion, Tadea needs the loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, oil and other things.

The “Once de Mayo-Huancarani” (May 11-Huancarani) communal bank meets monthly in Huancarani District of Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, oil and other things.

loans.name: 19 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Huyền has a retail business selling clothing. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell. She is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 19 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives with two dependents, and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huyền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Huancarani y tiene 39 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Actualmente, Domitila vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella tiene una pequeña ferretería donde vende diferentes tipos de productos como por ejemplo clavos, llantas, cables, focos y muchas cosas más. En esta oportunidad Domitila requiere el crédito para comprar clavos, calaminas, llantas y otras cosas mas. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Domitila was born in Paucartambo province, in the city of Huancarani.  She is 39 years old, and is married with four children.

Currently, Domitila lives in the same city where she was born, and this is where she works.  She has a small hardware store where she sells different types of products, for example nails, tires, cables, lights and many more things.  On this occasion, Domitila is requesting the loan to buy nails, roofing materials, tires and other additional items.

The “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” Communal Bank meets weekly in the district of Huancarani, in Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco (in Peru).  Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and also because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy nails, roofing materials, tires and other additional items.

loans.name: Mark Donnel

texts.en:
Mark Donnel is 30 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is a single man living with his parents.
 
He owns and operates a motorcycle to earn a living. It is called a "habal-habal" and carries 2-4 passengers. He also works in a private company on weekdays and takes on passengers after work and during weekends. This kind of vehicle is commonly seen in rural mountainous areas. He has been driving the vehicle for over 4 years and earns about PHP 7,000 each month. He has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to repair his existing engine.

Mark Donnel has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. He has requested loans five times from the cooperative and repaid them successfully. In the future, he hopes to use the motorcycle soon to pursue daily activities. He also plans to build a new house for the family to live comfortably.

loans.use: To repair an existing engine.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Pilcopata y tiene 42 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos. 

Actualmente, Julia vive en la ciudad de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de comida pero por el momento está trabajando en la municipalidad en el vivero forestal. En esta oportunidad Julia requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, verduras, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Julia was born in the province of Paucartambo in the city of Pilcopata. She is 42 years old, married and has two children.

At present, Julia lives in the city of Huancarani, where she does her economic activity. She sells food but at the moment she is working in a forest nursery. At this time, Julia needs the loan to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, rice, oil and more.

The “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” [May 11th- Huancarani] communal bank meets every month in the district of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, departament of Cuzco (Peru). Cuzco is known for being a tourist and commercial and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because Machu Picchu, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, is there.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 33 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children.
 
Perlita owns and operates a retail store at home selling mostly grocery items like shampoo, noodles, soap, toothpaste, rice and many more. She has run the store for over 4 years and has enjoyed the nature of this activity. Her husband as well works as a vehicle driver. She earns approximately PHP 6,200 a month from the store along with other sources. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

Perlita has been a member of GDMPC since 2007.  In the future, Perlita hopes to expand and improve store operations to sustain the day to day needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 47 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children.
 
Amalia owns and operates a sari-sari store in their place selling most of the basic commodities - groceries, school and office supplies, a few hardware products and accessories like hair clips, hair pins, headbands, etc. She has run the store for over 25 years. Her spouse works as a motorcycle driver from which a funding for store inventory is rarely taken. She receives approximately net income PHP 6,573 a month from from her general store and from her husband business. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding her store inventory.

Amalia has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. The previous loans were paid in full and this becomes her third cycle of borrowings in the cooperative. In the future, Amalia hopes to sustain her business subsistence and expand her business offerings. She expects to take another loan in the future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding store inventory.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Disability is not the clog for not working, Anabelle says. She is 44 years old, married and blessed with two children who are going to school. Anabelle engages in a retailing business at a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells eggs, cooking oil, shampoo and soap. 

Anabelle walks lamely; it is inborn but according to her, it is not a hindrance to achieving her goals. Anabelle has her sari-sari store stand in front of their house. 

Anabelle works hard to give a better quality of life for her family. She wants to maintain and develop her business. Anabelle is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy additional goods to sell in their village like toothpaste, noodles, spices and drinks. She hopes to increase her income by adding these goods to increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in their village like toothpaste, noodles, spices and drinks.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly, a 40-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, lives in Liposong, Ozamiz City, Philippines,  Behind Shirley is a slice cassava dried under the sun. To earn a living Shirley is selling the sliced dried cassava to her buyer. She has been in this activity for over 15 years, Shirly earns an estimated PHP 25,000 a month selling to a contract buyers. Shirley wants to expand her another line of business which is copra making, with this she asks financial assistance from GDMPC and requested a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to invest in expanding this activity.

Shirly joined the GDMPC family in 2008 and has since enjoyed the financial services offered by the cooperative. In the future, Shirly hopes to acquire more resources to sustain her business operation and sell her product for a higher price to some other buyers if possible. She also plans to improve her house to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her copra-making business.

loans.name: Carla Germania

texts.es:
Carla tiene 20 años es soltera y vive con sus padres en Latacunga. Carla se describe como una señorita de caracter fuerte y alegre.

Carla trabaja con sus padres en la crianza de animales (cerdos). Es la priemera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crèdito que solicita es para la compra de alimento para sus animales como es el balanceado para chanchos, lo cual ayudarà a que sus animales tengan un buen alimento y asì mejorar su calidad.

Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y tener salud para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Carla is 20 years old. She in single and lives with her parents in Latacunga. Carla is described as a cheerful young woman with a strong character. 

Carla works with her parents raising animals (pigs). This is the first time that she has worked with Fodemi. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy feed for her animals, such as balanced feed for pigs. This will help her animals to be well fed and improve their quality.

Her dream is to finish school and be healthy in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals, such as balanced feed for pigs.

loans.name: Rosamie

texts.en:
Rosamie wakes up early in the morning to cook foods, selling menus and snack foods from a cart that she pulls around their village. In the afternoon, she offers manicure and pedicure services to her village customers.

With a strong desire to uplift her family's living conditions and finance her children's education until college, Rosamie continues her daily routine, steadily earning higher returns on the business. She dreams of buying a sewing machine to create an additional source of income for the family.

Rosamie needs more working capital in order to expand her services in their village. She is requesting a loan of P6,000 to buy spices, meat, carrots and potatoes that she will use to cook more foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy spices, meat, carrots and potatoes that will used in cooking foods.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a happy person. Despite the everyday challenges and problems of both business and family life, she stands firm and maintains a healthy sense of humour. Married and blessed with four children, Zenaida arises early in the morning to cook snack foods such as banana que, soups and pancakes to sell around their village.

Zenaida is requesting a loan of P6,000 to buy bananas, macaroni shells and ingredients for snacks. She hopes that the loan will help her to improve her business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy bananas, macaroni shells and ingredients for snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and breed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business infrastructure

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Angeles has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles, breads & beverages.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Angeles has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Angeles hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Aida has a shop that buys and sells coconuts for copra.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts to sell.  Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves for her animal breeding business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia  is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children. 

Letecia  is providing pedicure, manicure and hair cutting in their house or home service.  She has had this business for 6 years. S he requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy materials needed for manicure and pedicure services.  Letecia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Letecia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicure & pedicure services

loans.name: Eliza's Group

texts.en:
Eliza is the leader of this group.  She is 41 and married to a farmer.  Together with her husband she brings up two daughters and three sons.  Two younger children are preschool age (under seven) and the other children are students.  The older son helps his parents in farming.  

In order to earn money the family cultivates agricultural products.  This year they grew two hectares of potatoes.  Eliza applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest and to buy potato packaging bags.  In the future Eliza wants to get another loan to purchase apples and pears for resale.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy potato packaging bags and fuel

loans.name: Robbie

texts.en:
Robbie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 

Robbie has a shop that buys and sells coconuts.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy coconuts to sell.  Robbie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Robbie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena, a 35-year-old married mother of three children, lives in the Philippines where she has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, breads and beverages. In business for four years and a member of HSPFI since 2010, Morena has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

In the future, Morena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul, a 38-year-old divorced mother of two daughters and a son, is the treasurer of this group. Her older daughter studies at school and the other children are of preschool age (under seven).

Nazgul works in the Regional Electro Station and is also engaged in sewing Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets, taking orders to earn additional money to meet the family's needs. Her daughter helps her in running the business. Nazgul started this activity two years ago with an initial investment of 10000 soms and now earns 6000 soms per month, profits that have made possible repairs to the house.

With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fabrics and materials to sew more pillows and blankets. In the future, Nazgul plans to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios got married at the age of 15. She is now 49 years old and happy with her husband and four children. Of her children, one is in the third year at college and the rest already have their own families. 

Remedios has engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store and meat vending for three years. At present, Remedios has temporarily stopped her meat-vending business because she has insufficient capital to continue this business. She spends her capital from the business for the education of her children. 

Remedios is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional goods to sell like eggs, beans, cooking oil and drinks for her sari-sari store. She hopes to earn a higher income and be able to continue her meat-vending business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Aizat's Group

texts.en:
Aizat is the treasurer of this group. She is 33 and together with her husband, who works as a teacher, she is bringing up two sons. The sons are preschool age (under seven), but they go to kindergarten. 

Aizat works as a teacher of geography in the local school. In order to earn additional money, the family breeds livestock. They started this activity five years ago. After her wedding, Aizat’s parents-in-law presented them three livestock animals, and since that time, Aizat has been engaged in livestock breeding. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she wants to provide her sons with a good education. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en:
Baltazar, 43, lives with his wife and three children. He runs a livestock business, particularly hog raising. Every day he wakes up early to feed and clean his animals and, once they arrive at an optimum size and weight, he offers them to his buyers. With the income he obtains from his business, he is able to meet their household expenses.

He would like to increase the number of hogs he raises and buy their respective feeds for their daily maintenance, but due to the expense of basic commodities, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. This amount would really help him. According to him, if his hogs were well-fed, he could offer them at a better price. 

Now, he is hoping to maintain the business he manages and improve their standard of living and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Jumagul's Group

texts.en:
Jumagul is the leader of this group. She is 27 and together with her husband, who works as an inspector, she is bringing up a daughter and a son. Both children are preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn additional money for the family budget, Jumagul breeds livestock. At the moment, she is keeping two cows and eight sheep. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase five animals for breeding. 

In the future Jumagul plans to purchase a family car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Khuderbat

texts.en:
Khuderbat, 34, makes Mongolian traditional shoes by hand, and he lives with his wife and his son in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 14 years, he has been making shoes and has gained a lot of experience in it. He sells his hand-made shoes wholesale to sellers at a bazaar called Narantuul, an international market, and they sell to the clients. Clients always feel satisfaction to buy his shoes.
  
Now he is planning to expand his business, but first he must renovate his shoe-craft tools and equipment. Also, he needs to purchase the raw materials such as leather for making shoes. This will enable him to increase his earning further and improve his family's living conditions.

He took a loan once before and repaid it successfully on time.

loans.use: To renovate his shoe-craft tools and equipment and purchase the raw materials for shoemaking.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail business for her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation to her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the leader of this group. She is 23 and married to a security guard. 

At the moment, the family breeds livestock and prepares hay to feed livestock during the winter season. Gulmira keeps eight cows, 30 sheep and three goats. Reselling some farm animals after fattening, she earns about 2,500 KGS per month. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of livestock. The loan's purpose is to purchase two sheep. In the future Gulmira wants to expand the business and improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep.

loans.name: Zayabayar

texts.en:
Zayabayar, 31, is a taxi driver who tries to work hard. He lives with his wife and three children in a his boss’s rental house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Before, he used to do passenger transportation and changed his business into taxi service recently. Besides that, he runs a phone-repair service in the morning.
 
He is one of fathers who wants to get a good education for their children. Now his son, Khongorjin, studies in a private Chinese language school and the fees are quite high. Therefore, he needs a loan to cover the school fee of his son. It is a actually important to him and his son’s future life.   

And Zayabazar has a plan to buy his own apartment where his family can live comfortably, and he has started saving from his daily earnings for his plan. But his taxi car, which is the main tool of his business, has had some defects lately. Therefore, he needs to renovate his car and is taking a loan to purchase the necessary spare parts for car repair as well as for his son’s school fee.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for car repair and to pay his son’s school fee.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag, 50, is a hairdresser, and she lives with her husband and a daughter in their own old house, which is located in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been running her barbershop for five years and works hard everyday. Sometimes she works as a cook when she has less work load.
 
Their house has been becoming old and it has been losing heat lately, so they need to make some adjustments. She decided to renovate and insulate the walls of house because Mongolian winter is freezing cold and unhealthy to live. Also there will be no heat loss after insulating and that will save on spending for fuel or firewood. 
  
Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to renovate and insulate her house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate and insulate her house.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold, 42, is a watchman in a public organization. He lives with his two children and his wife in Kherlen town of Dornod, a province of Mongolia. He has been doing his job since 1996. 

Actually, he is an agronomist but he has not been working in this occupation. But he wants to use it for his job and his life.  

He has a plan to have his own vegetable garden and sell the produce to urban clients. He said that he is going to use his profession in his own business and grow natural produce. Therefore, he decided to implement his plan through purchasing land in the suburbs as a vegetable garden. It will improve his family income and their living conditions.
 
Therefore, Enkhbold is taking a loan to purchase land as a vegetable garden.

loans.use: To purchase land for a vegetable garden.

loans.name: Jannat's Group

texts.en:
Jannat is the treasurer of this group. She is 56 and together with her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised a daughter. The daughter is twenty. She studies in the Police Academy and she is married. 

Jannat works as a librarian, and at the same time she is a teacher of history at a school. The family is engaged in livestock breeding. They started this activity about 20 years ago, so they have a big experience in this sphere. At the moment they keep two cows and six sheep. In case they need money to meet the family needs, they can sell some livestock. With money received from the loan Jannat wants to purchase five sheep in order to expand the number of livestock. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase five sheep.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Teofila has a shop that sells clothing, underwear & beauty products. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock from AVON, NATASHA & MSE to sell.

Teofila has been a member of HSPFI since 2000. In the future, Teofila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON, NATASHA & MSE to sell.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Bernadette has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from different suppliers. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional stock from AVON, NATASHA & FULLERLIFE.

Bernadette has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock from AVON, NATASHA & FULLERLIFE.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with five children; four attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has been selling clothing, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of low customer turn-out during low seasons. She dreams of expanding her business and educating her children in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sanavar's Group

texts.en:
Sanavar is the leader of this group. She is 40 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she has raised two daughters and a son. The older daughter is married, the second daughter studies at Kyrgyz National University and the son is at school. Sanavar works as a cook at a school; she earns additional money by selling stationery and confectionery. 

She started this business five years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms and in this way she earns an additional 4000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Sanavar wants to increase the assortment of goods she sells. She wants to purchase more confectionery to sell. In the future she wishes to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase confectionery.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 53 years of age and is married. She is married to a generous farmer, working in the Philippines. Andrea and her husband engage in farming, planting and harvesting rice. They will just earn income during the harvesting season.

In order to sustain their daily needs, Andrea’s husband operates his "tricycle" for passenger transportation. Their income from it goes to their daily household use. Andrea wants to repaint their tricycle and change some of the tires for better service.

Andrea is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy a tricycle wheel and paint to use in improving their tricycle for better service.

loans.use: to buy a "tricycle" wheel and paint to use in improving their "tricycle" for better service.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a tailoring business which forms her other source income. She faces a major challenge of low income during the rainy season. She dreams of expanding her business and constructing real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and other greengrocery items. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions and other greengrocery items.

loans.name: Mry Claire

texts.en:
Mry Claire is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Mry Claire has a garden where she plants & sells fruits & non-fruit tree seedlings. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for fruit tree seedlings.

Mry Claire has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mry Claire hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for fruit tree seedlings.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Estela has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Estela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Estela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: I Gusti Ketut

texts.en:
As the backbone of the family, it’s become an obligation to meet all the needs of families. Apart from general farm businesses, something else that could help meet the needs of daily living by farming in particular is working as a vegetable farmer. In development there are some obstacles encountered in the development business, such as limited knowledge of business management as well as limited access to capital. To solve the problem of a father, I Gusti Ketut has joined MUK.

I Gusti Ketut, 27 years old, is a young farmer who runs a business of agriculture. To improve the business. I Gusti Ketut is participating in loan programs for small businesses from MUK. This loan will be allocated to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer supplies. Within 3 months, cabbage, for example, is ready for sale, and the profits used to meet family needs and for development of the farm itself. The advantage of this effort will be saved for his marriage preparation.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer supplies.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 26 years old and a married woman. She is thankful because she has been blessed with two children. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for six years. 

Analiza is requesting a loan amount of P25,000 in order to purchase feed for her hogs. Her loan request  will help her to maintain a larger number of hogs and improve their weight so when she sells them, she will earn a greater profit.She hopes that she can make her business grow continually to improve the quality of their life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Melodina has a food shop that sells banana & sweet potato "cues". She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making banana cue.

Melodina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Melodina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making banana "cue" (fried banana on a stick).

loans.name: Jero

texts.en:
It is not only the responsibility as a head of household in the family, but also the duty of a wife to provide support in meeting all the needs of families. Apart from her husband's business, Jero is a vegetable farmer who supports her husband's efforts in meeting the needs of his family. She supplements her husband's income with farming, particularly the growing of broccoli. 

In development there are some obstacles encountered in the development business, such as limited knowledge of business management as well as limited access to capital. To resolve the issue Jero has joined MUK.

Jero, 55, is a farmer who runs a vegetable farm. To improve her business Jero is participating in loan programs for small businesses from MUK. This loan will be used to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer supplies. Within 3 months, the vegetable broccoli will be ready for sale, and the profits used to meet family needs and for development of the farm itself.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн проживает в городе Душанбе. Он женат. Ему 37 лет. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу. Хусейн арендует помещение, где открыл ателье. Он в основном занимается шитьем костюмов. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей и ниток.
texts.en: Huseyn lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 37 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Huseyn provides a service.  He leases a space, where he opened a studio.  He primarily sews suits.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Huseyn is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics and threads.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and threads

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a meat goat selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Mr. Tho is located in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He is 44 years old, a widower, and has three children. All of his children are living under his care and are of school age. To raise his children in a good situation and with a good education, Mr. Tho always works hard every day for his children’s future. 

Currently, Mr. Tho is able to use his daily income of around $5 USD each day, earned as a car driver. In order to upgrade their living, Mr. Tho would like to purchase a plot of land for building a new house, but he faces a problem with the financial factor. That is the reason why Mr. Tho has requested some funds from HKL and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to build a new house.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en: Moustafa is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has owned a barber shop since 2004 with seven years of experience working in the same occupation. He is well known in the whole region for his good business reputation and his great welcoming. Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase a special machine for the black color below the eyes and for facial treatment necessary to improve his business. This is his third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business, at the same time he is a borrower with a good standing history. His income is considered almost reasonable and he struggles to be able to face the uncomfortable life circumstances. In the future, Moustafa is planning to improve his work and enlarge his shop to add new beauty and massage services, in addition to selling cosmetics, beauty products and perfumes.

loans.use: To buy a special machine for the black color below the eyes and for facial treatment necessary to improve his business

loans.name: Duhuzubumwe / Kzh Group

texts.fr:
Isaac fait partie du groupe Duhuzubumwe KZH. Le nom du groupe signifie « unir les forces ». Isaac est né au Rwanda. Il est célibataire avec 4 personnes en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est l’école primaire. 

Isaac est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver des races améliorées de riz dans un espace minimum et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Isaac voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit de satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
Isaac is a member of Duhuzubumwe KZH Group, which means "uniting forces". He was born in Rwanda. He is single with four people in his care. He attended elementary school.

Isaac is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

His growth strategy consists in growing improved rice varieties, cultivating a small acreage and yielding a good harvest. In the years to come Isaac would like to become one of the best rice farmers in his valley. He will use his profit to meet his basic needs.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

loans.name: Kundumurimo Nº 54 / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Venuste fait partie du groupe Kundumurimo Nº54 / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « aimer le travail ». Venuste est né au Rwanda. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 2 à 18 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Venuste est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver peu d’espace en utilisant des engrais chimiques afin de récolter une grande quantité de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Venuste voudrait devenir le meilleur cultivateur de sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants jusqu’au niveau de l’université et s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Venuste is a member of Kundumurimo N° 54 / RSZ Group, which means "loving the work". He was born in Rwanda. He is married and the father of six children, aged 2 to 18. Four of his children attend school. He attended elementary school until sixth grade.

Venuste is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

His growth strategy consists in cultivating a small acreage using chemical fertilizers and yielding a good harvest. In the years to come Venuste would like to become the best rice farmer in his valley. He will use his profit to pay school fees for his children until university level, and to become self-financing.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
To further finance the family needs, Merlita generates an income from planting various vegetables in their backyard and farm. Merlita has been engaged in this type of business for 11 years. She is not getting tired of doing her business because she loves what she does. Merlita plants creeping vegetables in their backyard such as string beans, squash and seguidillas. Merlita wanted to plant more vegetables to increase her sales and at the same time increase her profits to further support her five children attending school.

Merlita is looking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seeds of eggplant, bitter gourd and sponge gourd to plant on their farm. She wishes for the growth of her business for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds of eggplant, bitter gourd and sponge gourd to plant on their farm

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is 53 years old and lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five lovely children, three of them have already married and live independently, the other two are single. Most rural people have been generating a business such as agriculture and raising livestock. Mrs. Sok and her husband have been running a business as domestic rice farmers. From this, they earn an income on average of $3 USD each day. 

This is the rainy season so it is so good for them to plant their rice crop. As she lacks money to start planting, Mrs. Sok would like to borrow some loan funds in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming materials. She hopes that this loan will make their family meet happiness and gain more profit. 

Note: Mrs. Sok and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe A / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Théogène fait parti du groupe Abunzubumwe A / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « unir les gens ». Théogène est né au Rwanda. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 3 à 18 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de primaire. 

Théogène est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de cultiver à temps, de cultiver une race améliorée et de vendre une grande quantité de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Théogène voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Théogène is a member of Abunzuwumbe A / Rusizi Group, which means "uniting people". He was born in Rwanda. He is married and the father of six children, aged 3 to 18. Three of his children attend school. He attended elementary school until fourth grade.

Théogène is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

His growth strategy consists in early planting, growing an improved rice variety and selling large quantities of rice. In the years to come Théogène would like to become one of the best rice farmers in his valley. He will use his profit to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

loans.name: Abdulkosim

texts.ru: Абдулкосим проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат. У него четверо детей. Его сын находится в России на заработках. Сам он более семи лет занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdulkosim, 56, lives in Tajikistan's Jomi region. He is married with four children. His son works in Russia. Abdulkosim breeds cattle. He is applying for a loan to purchase a few cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a few cattle

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is 38 years old and a married father of 3 children, ages between 3 and 24 years old. He is a livestock farmer in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for 5 years and is doing well.

This marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase more goats. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business.

Omari's dream is to become a very successful businessman and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goats

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie biggest dream in life is to give her children the opportunity to go to school through the college level. She hopes to reach that goal by running a business raising and selling hogs, and continually strives to make it better and more profitable. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy feed for her herd, and believes that this loan will have a positive impact on her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her herd of pigs.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mrs.Ven is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in the Baray District of Kompong Thom Province. She has married Mr. Chea who is a rice cultivator. They have given birth to two kids who are living under their care. To make a living, Mrs. Ven sells different kinds of goods in her community. She can earn about $3 USD per day in her selling business. Mrs. Ven sells basic necessities, for example milk, rice, oil, toilet paper, eggs, some fruit, etc. To upgrade to a comfortable life, her husband has decided with her to purchase a plowing machine but they do not have enough cash to buy one. So Mrs. Ven and her husband are requesting a loan through HKL, a partner with Kiva, to purchase a plowing machine to help support in farming business as well as use for transportation firewood to sell in the marketplace. Mrs. Ven is expecting that this loan will make her family earn more benefits. In the future, she hopes to send her children to study at the university.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine to help support in farming business as well as use for transportation firewood to sell.

loans.name: Nukra

texts.ru: Нукра жительница района А. Джоми. Ей 66 лет. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Ее сын занимается животноводством. Сама Нукра занимается разведением скота у себя дома. Она в основном откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Nukra, a 66-year-old widow, lives with her three children in Tajikistan's Jomi region. Her son breeds cattle. Nukra breeds cattle in her household for sales. She has been in this business for ten years and is applying for a loan in order to buy a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is 46 years old, married and the father of five children. Since 1980, he has made a living by owning and running a store where he soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has 31 years of experience in this field and a deep understanding of the needs of his customers. His store is in a very good area with lots of customers passing by. 

It is common at all levels of this society for people to have multiple businesses, which is why Abbass also does body work on cars. He enjoys this business and hopes to improve and expand it as much as he can by opening a suitable garage and buying all the necessary equipment. Until he can afford the capital he needs to do this, Abbass has decided to apply for a loan to buy a new van to work on that he can use as a bus to generate additional income. He is applying for this loan, his third, from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, after repaying his first two loans completely and on time and thereby becoming a borrower in very good standing.

Abbass is aiming to earn more profits so that he can provide a better life to his family and and open a repair garage.

loans.use: To buy a small van to work on and use as a bus.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 34 years old, married to Alfred who is a primary school teacher. She is blessed with two children aged six and four years. She operates a cosmetic shop in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for six years earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000. With need for growth and expansion of her business, she has borrowed a second loan from KADET LTD of KES. 60,000 to enable her to purchase weaves, body lotions, hair dyes, hair braids and hair treatments for her business. The anticipated profits she will use to diversify her business. Her dream is to own her own plot and build a personal house.

loans.use: To purchase stock like weaves, body lotions, hair dyes, hair braids & hair treatments

loans.name: Lount

texts.en: Mrs. Lount, age 25, is a married woman and the mother of two single children. Two of the children are attending the local school. She is a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Most of the people in this region work in agriculture, raise livestock and have a fishing business. Presently, Mrs. Lount and her husband work in the fishing sector. They have been doing this since 2000 and make a profit of about $6 USD per day to use for their daily expenses. Presently, the family has a problem with their fishing business, as some fishing tools are broken. To solve this situation, Mrs. Lount and her husband would like to ask for a loan to buy nets and a new motorboat to replace the old and broken equipment.

loans.use: to buy nets and a new motorboat

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis, 51, is a resident of San Miguel Ramon. He is married having two children. By the grace of God and with the help of his supportive wife, he is able to provide for his children’s needs. Luis runs a hog raising business that he has been managing for two years. He raises and fattens them, and sells them at their optimum growth and size. To help him continue running his business, he is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P10,000. He will use the loan to buy feed so he can improve the weight and size of his piglets and sell them at a greater price. Luis is aiming to add more piglets in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed supplies for his hog raising business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 34 years old, married to Boniface. Together they have four children aged six, 10, 13 and 14 years. She operates a cereals store in the busy Kiptuyia trading center. She has been in the business for the past two years. Her monthly income from the business is KES 10,000. This is her third loan term in KADET. She repaid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to purchase five bags of dry maize, two bags of dry beans, one bag of millet and one bag of groundnuts to increase her stock. Anticipated profits will be used to educate her children and cater for their upkeep. Her dream is to improve her business and be self sustainable

loans.use: To purchase cereals for resale

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Melba is 42 years old and has one child who is in school.
