Melba has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines. Melba requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Melba has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Melba would like to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven, 33, is a humble villager who lives in the Kompong Speu province. She has given birth to four children. Two of them are employed as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh, where they can earn enough salary per month to contribute with Mrs. Ven. The other two are attending public school. 

Currently Mrs. Ven is a pig breeder, earning about $1.66 US per day. Taking time from this business, Mrs. Ven is also selling groceries in front of her house. She has pigs from a few months ago, but they are not growing well, so she has decided with her family to request some funding from HKL and Kiva. She will use this loan to buy some feed to fatten up her pigs. 

Mrs. Ven and her husband are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy some feed to fatten up her pigs.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and also earns an income from knitting and food vending. Arlyn requested a 19,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store. She has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. Arlyn hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell

loans.name: Kerionka

texts.en: Kerionka is 48 years old married to Mututua and they are blessed with children. Her primary business is livestock trading. She has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES.5,000 per month. She was introduced to KADET by KADET staff. She has a good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her second loan. She plans to use KES.10,000 to buy livestock and the rest to pay school fees. She will use the extra profit to pay fees. She hopes to become a prominent business person. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and pay fees.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a vinegar and salt vending business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of salt and vinegar to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of salt and vinegar to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 56 and owns a sari-sari store (a small retail shop), from which she sells snack food, cooking staples such as vinegar and cooking oil, and soft drinks.  According to Pacita, she is practiced the hardships of life and that’s why she keeps on working. Aside from her sari-sari store, Pacita sells sandwiches door-to-door in her village.  Pacita plans to use this loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy bread, sandwich spread, and soft drinks to sell. She hopes she will be able to buy enough merchandise for her sari-sari store to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy bread, sandwich spread, and soft drinks

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 38 years old and married with one child currently going to school. Josie works very hard to provide for them.

Josie runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Josie has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Josie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana, a 29-year-old married mother of two, has been operating a retail shop in Mshomoroni, Mombasa for the last three years. She was recently introduced to KADET LTD, and this marks her first loan, with which she plans to buy more maize meal, soft drinks, wheat flour and rice.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand her business. Diana's dream is to become a successful businesslady.

loans.use: to acquire more maize meal, soft drinks, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Mitos

texts.en:
Mitos is 37 years old and married with four children.

Mitos works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mitos has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and earns additional income from food vending.

Mitos aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: 13 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiếu, a 38-year-old married mother of two, is the group leader of the 13 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members.

Hiếu lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province, where she has operated a food stall selling fruit for four years. One of the critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital, so she is now requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase fruit to resell.

In the future, Hiếu hopes for her business to do well, to earn enough money to provide for her children, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 39-year-old married man, who lives with his wife and two children. He has owned a bakery since 2003, and has 21 years of experience in this field. He serves the famous traditional Manoucheh with special toppings (cheese, thyme, spicy cheese, meat, etc.). He is talented in his business and his customers enjoy the tasty foods he creates.
Marwan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new updated machine for his bakery, in addition to completing building two additional rooms at his house. This is Marwan's first loan from Al Majmoua. He hopes it will have a great positive effect on his business in addition to his family's social and financial situation. 
Marwan hopes to further expand his business by moving to a bigger place to accommodate eating-in customers.

loans.use: to buy a new updated machine for his bakery.

loans.name: Usuhbayar

texts.en:
Usuhbayar is 36 years old and lives with her four children in a ger in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. She is the only provider for her family.  Her four children are high school students. 
Usuhbayar started her business in 2007 by selling meat. Even though her income is relatively low, she is happy with it and has a very bright vision for her children and herself. She is a diligent and open-minded person who says, 'I'll expand my business and some day I hope to be a successful and well experienced businesswoman.' She is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase meat and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase meat and livestock.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 74 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Nicanora is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nicanora has been fattening pigs for 20 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old and single. Nancy works very hard.

Nancy runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Nancy has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: 7 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngát is 51 years old and married with three dependent children. She is the group leader of the 7 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.
Mrs Ngát operates a food stall selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. In 2010, Ngát joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngát has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main hardship that Ngát faces in her business is lack of capital. With her business profits, Ngát hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita works hard to support her family. Julita is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Julita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Julita has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Julita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beverly is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Beverly has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. Beverly requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.  In the future, Beverly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Danila

texts.en:
Danila works hard to support her family. Danila is married and sells personal products in the Philippines.

Danila requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell to customers.

Danila has been in this business for three years now and earns additional income from her general store.

In the future, Danila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jonalyn is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jonalyn has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergents, breads, and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Jonalyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, bread, and other miscellaneous items to sell

loans.name: Syrga

texts.ru:
Сырга – 52 – летняя фермерша, живущая на юге Кыргызстана. Замужем и имеет 5 детей. Сырга со своей семьей занимается животноводством и заготовкой и реализацией сельхоз продукции. Сырга начала этот бизнес более 15 лет назад, купив на накопленные деньги корову и сумела развить хозяйство до 6 голов крупного рогатого скота. Прибыль от бизнеса помогла Сырге  дать достойное приданое своим 2 детям и помочь в их собственных хозяйствах.  Ежемесячно, в семейный бюджет семьи Сырги попадает 5,000-6,000 сом (KGS)от продажи мясных и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сырга обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма.
На доходы от кредита, Саргы планирует  дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в бдущем – женить сыновей и дать хорошее приданое своей дочери.
texts.en: Syrga is a 52-year-old farmer living in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is married with five children. Syrga and her family breed cattle and sell agricultural products. Syrga started this business fifteen years ago when she bought a cow for the money she had saved. She managed to grow her business; now she owns six heads of cattle. The profits from this business helped Syrga provide her children with good dowry and contribute to her children's households.  The family's monthly profits from the sales of meat and dairy products range between 5,000 and 6,000 Kyrgyz som. In order to expand her business, Syrga turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 135,000 Kyrgyz som. She is planning to use the loan for buying more cattle and to use the profits for expanding her business by increasing the number of cattle. In the future, she will use the money for her son's marriages and her daughter's dowry.

loans.use: to purchase cattle
